The I’ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabi—ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, I’m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure you’re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:✅ Check Their License – Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.✅ Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder – Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agent’s profile and credentials before engaging.✅ Research Their Reputation – Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.✅ Work with Established Agencies – Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabi’s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.🚨 Red Flags to Avoid:❌ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisions❌ Deals that seem too good to be true❌ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contracts❌ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Client’s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isn’t just about choosing the right agent—it’s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlord’s office, thinking it will speed things up. But here’s the truth: a good agent can sense when they’re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do best—find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, you’ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

🚀 𝐃𝐮𝐛𝐚𝐢’𝐬 𝐑𝐞𝐚𝐥 𝐄𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐤𝐞𝐭 𝐢𝐧 𝐐𝟏 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟓: 𝐖𝐡𝐲 𝐈𝐧𝐯𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐬 𝐂𝐚𝐧’𝐭 𝐀𝐟𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐌𝐢𝐬𝐬 𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐁𝐨𝐨𝐦 🚀⁣⁣The numbers are in – and Dubai’s property market isn’t just thriving; it’s rewriting the rules. If you’re still on the sidelines, here’s what you’re missing:⁣⁣🔥 𝐐𝟏 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟓 𝐇𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐥𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭𝐬 🔥⁣✅ 𝐀𝐄𝐃 𝟏𝟖𝟐𝐁 𝐢𝐧 𝐓𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐬𝐚𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬: 𝐀 𝟐𝟕% 𝐘𝐨𝐘 𝐬𝐮𝐫𝐠𝐞 – the strongest Q1 in a decade.⁣✅ 𝐎𝐟𝐟-𝐏𝐥𝐚𝐧 𝐃𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞: 62% 𝘰𝘧 𝘴𝘢𝘭𝘦𝘴 𝘥𝘳𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘯 𝘣𝘺 𝘮𝘦𝘨𝘢-𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘫𝘦𝘤𝘵𝘴 𝘭𝘪𝘬𝘦 𝘗𝘢𝘭𝘮 𝘑𝘦𝘣𝘦𝘭 𝘈𝘭𝘪 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘋𝘶𝘣𝘢𝘪 𝘚𝘰𝘶𝘵𝘩.⁣✅ 𝐋𝐮𝐱𝐮𝐫𝐲 𝐒𝐞𝐠𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐒𝐨𝐚𝐫𝐬: 𝘈𝘌𝘋 500𝘔+ 𝘷𝘪𝘭𝘭𝘢𝘴 𝘪𝘯 𝘌𝘮𝘪𝘳𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘴 𝘏𝘪𝘭𝘭𝘴 𝘴𝘰𝘭𝘥 𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘪𝘯 𝘶𝘯𝘥𝘦𝘳 72 𝘩𝘰𝘶𝘳𝘴.⁣✅ 𝐑𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐚𝐥 𝐘𝐢𝐞𝐥𝐝𝐬 𝐚𝐭 𝟖.𝟓%: 𝘖𝘶𝘵𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘧𝘰𝘳𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘨𝘭𝘰𝘣𝘢𝘭 𝘩𝘶𝘣𝘴 𝘭𝘪𝘬𝘦 𝘓𝘰𝘯𝘥𝘰𝘯 (3.2%) 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘕𝘠𝘊 (4.1%).⁣✅ 𝐍𝐞𝐰 𝐈𝐧𝐯𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐨𝐫 𝐈𝐧𝐜𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐯𝐞𝐬: 10-year Golden Visas fast-tracked for property buyers over AED 2M.⁣✅ 𝐓𝐞𝐜𝐡-𝐃𝐫𝐢𝐯𝐞𝐧 𝐆𝐫𝐨𝐰𝐭𝐡: 45% of deals closed via blockchain platforms – fastest in the world.⁣⁣𝐖𝐡𝐲 𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐌𝐚𝐭𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐬 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐘𝐎𝐔:⁣🏙️ 𝐅𝐮𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞-𝐏𝐫𝐨𝐨𝐟 𝐑𝐞𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐧𝐬: With Expo 2030 and The Dubai Urban Plan 2040 underway, infrastructure spending is set to hit AED 1T – and early investors will reap the rewards.⁣🌍 𝐆𝐥𝐨𝐛𝐚𝐥 𝐒𝐚𝐟𝐞 𝐇𝐚𝐯𝐞𝐧: Amid geopolitical volatility, Dubai remains a magnet for HNWIs (30% increase in residency applications this quarter).

The I’ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabi—ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, I’m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure you’re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:✅ Check Their License – Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.✅ Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder – Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agent’s profile and credentials before engaging.✅ Research Their Reputation – Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.✅ Work with Established Agencies – Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabi’s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.🚨 Red Flags to Avoid:❌ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisions❌ Deals that seem too good to be true❌ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contracts❌ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Client’s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isn’t just about choosing the right agent—it’s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlord’s office, thinking it will speed things up. But here’s the truth: a good agent can sense when they’re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do best—find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, you’ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

.أعلنت hashtag#هيئة_الطرق_و_المواصلات في دبي أن إجمالي عدد ركاب وسائل النقل الجماعي ومركبات الأجرة والتنقل المشترك خلال عطلة عيد الفطر المبارك 1446 هجرية 2025 ميلادية، (من 30 مارس وحتى 1 أبريل الجاري)، بلغ 6 ملايين و390 ألف راكب. وأوضحت الهيئة أن عدد ركاب المترو بخطيه الأحمر والأخضر، خلال العطلة، وصل إلى 2 مليون و427 ألف راكب، بينما بلغ عدد ركاب الترام 111,130 راكب، وعدد ركاب الحافلات العامة مليون و329 ألف راكب، ووصل عدد ركاب وسائل النقل البحري إلى 408 ألف راكب، ونقلت مركبات الأجرة (تاكسي دبي وشركات الامتياز) 1 مليون و686 ألف راكب، فيما سجلت أعداد ركاب التنقّل المشترك (والتي تشمل مركبات شركات التطبيقات الذكية ومركبات التأجير بالساعات والحافلات عند الطلب) 429,616 راكباً.لقراءة الخبر، تفضل بزيارة rta.aeDubai’s hashtag#RTA announced that the total number of passengers using public transport, taxis, and shared mobility services during the Eid Al-Fitr holiday 1446H / 2025 (from 30 March to 1 April) reached 6.390 million.The Dubai Metro, operating across both the Red and Green Lines, transported 2.428 million riders. Dubai Tram served 111,130 passengers, while public buses carried 1.330 million commuters.Marine transport services recorded 408,991 boardings, and taxis—including Dubai Taxi and franchise operators—served 1.687 million users. Shared mobility services—including e-hail vehicles, hourly car rentals, and on-demand buses—registered 429,616 riders across various platforms.To read the full news, please visit rta.ae

Job Market Insights from a Top Recruitment Agency in DubaiI recently had a discussion with a leading recruitment company hiring across the Middle East, and here are the key takeaways:✅ Salary ExpectationsFor Software Engineers with 5-6 years of experience (in strong tech stacks, the salary range provided to recruitment agencies is 20-30K SAR/month. However, your next salary increment will likely be based on your current pay. So, negotiate well—don’t settle for less!✅ Recruitment ProcessUnlike many Western markets, most companies here don’t use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems). Instead, recruiters manually review 8-10 resumes daily, meaning quality matters more than quantity.✅ Maximize Your Visibility •	Follow all major recruitment agencies and connect with recruiters in your field. •	Set up job alerts on their platforms. •	Email recruiters directly with a strong, well-crafted CV.Your job search isn’t just about applying—it’s about standing out!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#MiddleEastJobs hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SalaryNegotiation hashtag#RecruitmentTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#RiyadhJobs

.أعلنت hashtag#هيئة_الطرق_و_المواصلات في دبي أن إجمالي عدد ركاب وسائل النقل الجماعي ومركبات الأجرة والتنقل المشترك خلال عطلة عيد الفطر المبارك 1446 هجرية 2025 ميلادية، (من 30 مارس وحتى 1 أبريل الجاري)، بلغ 6 ملايين و390 ألف راكب. وأوضحت الهيئة أن عدد ركاب المترو بخطيه الأحمر والأخضر، خلال العطلة، وصل إلى 2 مليون و427 ألف راكب، بينما بلغ عدد ركاب الترام 111,130 راكب، وعدد ركاب الحافلات العامة مليون و329 ألف راكب، ووصل عدد ركاب وسائل النقل البحري إلى 408 ألف راكب، ونقلت مركبات الأجرة (تاكسي دبي وشركات الامتياز) 1 مليون و686 ألف راكب، فيما سجلت أعداد ركاب التنقّل المشترك (والتي تشمل مركبات شركات التطبيقات الذكية ومركبات التأجير بالساعات والحافلات عند الطلب) 429,616 راكباً.لقراءة الخبر، تفضل بزيارة rta.aeDubai’s hashtag#RTA announced that the total number of passengers using public transport, taxis, and shared mobility services during the Eid Al-Fitr holiday 1446H / 2025 (from 30 March to 1 April) reached 6.390 million.The Dubai Metro, operating across both the Red and Green Lines, transported 2.428 million riders. Dubai Tram served 111,130 passengers, while public buses carried 1.330 million commuters.Marine transport services recorded 408,991 boardings, and taxis—including Dubai Taxi and franchise operators—served 1.687 million users. Shared mobility services—including e-hail vehicles, hourly car rentals, and on-demand buses—registered 429,616 riders across various platforms.To read the full news, please visit rta.ae

Job Market Insights from a Top Recruitment Agency in DubaiI recently had a discussion with a leading recruitment company hiring across the Middle East, and here are the key takeaways:✅ Salary ExpectationsFor Software Engineers with 5-6 years of experience (in strong tech stacks, the salary range provided to recruitment agencies is 20-30K SAR/month. However, your next salary increment will likely be based on your current pay. So, negotiate well—don’t settle for less!✅ Recruitment ProcessUnlike many Western markets, most companies here don’t use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems). Instead, recruiters manually review 8-10 resumes daily, meaning quality matters more than quantity.✅ Maximize Your Visibility •	Follow all major recruitment agencies and connect with recruiters in your field. •	Set up job alerts on their platforms. •	Email recruiters directly with a strong, well-crafted CV.Your job search isn’t just about applying—it’s about standing out!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#MiddleEastJobs hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SalaryNegotiation hashtag#RecruitmentTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#RiyadhJobs

The I’ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabi—ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, I’m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure you’re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:✅ Check Their License – Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.✅ Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder – Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agent’s profile and credentials before engaging.✅ Research Their Reputation – Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.✅ Work with Established Agencies – Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabi’s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.🚨 Red Flags to Avoid:❌ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisions❌ Deals that seem too good to be true❌ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contracts❌ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Client’s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isn’t just about choosing the right agent—it’s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlord’s office, thinking it will speed things up. But here’s the truth: a good agent can sense when they’re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do best—find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, you’ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

However, your next salary increment will likely be based on your current pay. So, negotiate well—don’t settle for less!✅ Recruitment ProcessUnlike many Western markets, most companies here don’t use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems). Instead, recruiters manually review 8-10 resumes daily, meaning quality matters more than quantity.✅ Maximize Your Visibility •	Follow all major recruitment agencies and connect with recruiters in your field. •	Set up job alerts on their platforms. •	Email recruiters directly with a strong, well-crafted CV.Your job search isn’t just about applying—it’s about standing out!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#MiddleEastJobs hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SalaryNegotiation hashtag#RecruitmentTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#RiyadhJobs

The I’ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabi—ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, I’m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure you’re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:✅ Check Their License – Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.✅ Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder – Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agent’s profile and credentials before engaging.✅ Research Their Reputation – Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.✅ Work with Established Agencies – Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabi’s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.🚨 Red Flags to Avoid:❌ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisions❌ Deals that seem too good to be true❌ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contracts❌ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Client’s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isn’t just about choosing the right agent—it’s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlord’s office, thinking it will speed things up. But here’s the truth: a good agent can sense when they’re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do best—find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, you’ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

Post Content:
.أعلنت hashtag#هيئة_الطرق_و_المواصلات في دبي أن إجمالي عدد ركاب وسائل النقل الجماعي ومركبات الأجرة والتنقل المشترك خلال عطلة عيد الفطر المبارك 1446 هجرية 2025 ميلادية، (من 30 مارس وحتى 1 أبريل الجاري)، بلغ 6 ملايين و390 ألف راكب. وأوضحت الهيئة أن عدد ركاب المترو بخطيه الأحمر والأخضر، خلال العطلة، وصل إلى 2 مليون و427 ألف راكب، بينما بلغ عدد ركاب الترام 111,130 راكب، وعدد ركاب الحافلات العامة مليون و329 ألف راكب، ووصل عدد ركاب وسائل النقل البحري إلى 408 ألف راكب، ونقلت مركبات الأجرة (تاكسي دبي وشركات الامتياز) 1 مليون و686 ألف راكب، فيما سجلت أعداد ركاب التنقّل المشترك (والتي تشمل مركبات شركات التطبيقات الذكية ومركبات التأجير بالساعات والحافلات عند الطلب) 429,616 راكباً.لقراءة الخبر، تفضل بزيارة rta.aeDubai’s hashtag#RTA announced that the total number of passengers using public transport, taxis, and shared mobility services during the Eid Al-Fitr holiday 1446H / 2025 (from 30 March to 1 April) reached 6.390 million.The Dubai Metro, operating across both the Red and Green Lines, transported 2.428 million riders. Dubai Tram served 111,130 passengers, while public buses carried 1.330 million commuters.Marine transport services recorded 408,991 boardings, and taxis—including Dubai Taxi and franchise operators—served 1.687 million users. Shared mobility services—including e-hail vehicles, hourly car rentals, and on-demand buses—registered 429,616 riders across various platforms.To read the full news, please visit rta.ae

Job Market Insights from a Top Recruitment Agency in DubaiI recently had a discussion with a leading recruitment company hiring across the Middle East, and here are the key takeaways:✅ Salary ExpectationsFor Software Engineers with 5-6 years of experience (in strong tech stacks, the salary range provided to recruitment agencies is 20-30K SAR/month. However, your next salary increment will likely be based on your current pay. So, negotiate well—don’t settle for less!✅ Recruitment ProcessUnlike many Western markets, most companies here don’t use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems). Instead, recruiters manually review 8-10 resumes daily, meaning quality matters more than quantity.✅ Maximize Your Visibility •	Follow all major recruitment agencies and connect with recruiters in your field. •	Set up job alerts on their platforms. •	Email recruiters directly with a strong, well-crafted CV.Your job search isn’t just about applying—it’s about standing out!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#MiddleEastJobs hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SalaryNegotiation hashtag#RecruitmentTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#RiyadhJobs

.أعلنت hashtag#هيئة_الطرق_و_المواصلات في دبي أن إجمالي عدد ركاب وسائل النقل الجماعي ومركبات الأجرة والتنقل المشترك خلال عطلة عيد الفطر المبارك 1446 هجرية 2025 ميلادية، (من 30 مارس وحتى 1 أبريل الجاري)، بلغ 6 ملايين و390 ألف راكب. وأوضحت الهيئة أن عدد ركاب المترو بخطيه الأحمر والأخضر، خلال العطلة، وصل إلى 2 مليون و427 ألف راكب، بينما بلغ عدد ركاب الترام 111,130 راكب، وعدد ركاب الحافلات العامة مليون و329 ألف راكب، ووصل عدد ركاب وسائل النقل البحري إلى 408 ألف راكب، ونقلت مركبات الأجرة (تاكسي دبي وشركات الامتياز) 1 مليون و686 ألف راكب، فيما سجلت أعداد ركاب التنقّل المشترك (والتي تشمل مركبات شركات التطبيقات الذكية ومركبات التأجير بالساعات والحافلات عند الطلب) 429,616 راكباً.لقراءة الخبر، تفضل بزيارة rta.aeDubai’s hashtag#RTA announced that the total number of passengers using public transport, taxis, and shared mobility services during the Eid Al-Fitr holiday 1446H / 2025 (from 30 March to 1 April) reached 6.390 million.The Dubai Metro, operating across both the Red and Green Lines, transported 2.428 million riders. Dubai Tram served 111,130 passengers, while public buses carried 1.330 million commuters.Marine transport services recorded 408,991 boardings, and taxis—including Dubai Taxi and franchise operators—served 1.687 million users. Shared mobility services—including e-hail vehicles, hourly car rentals, and on-demand buses—registered 429,616 riders across various platforms.To read the full news, please visit rta.ae

Job Market Insights from a Top Recruitment Agency in DubaiI recently had a discussion with a leading recruitment company hiring across the Middle East, and here are the key takeaways:✅ Salary ExpectationsFor Software Engineers with 5-6 years of experience (in strong tech stacks, the salary range provided to recruitment agencies is 20-30K SAR/month. However, your next salary increment will likely be based on your current pay. So, negotiate well—don’t settle for less!✅ Recruitment ProcessUnlike many Western markets, most companies here don’t use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems). Instead, recruiters manually review 8-10 resumes daily, meaning quality matters more than quantity.✅ Maximize Your Visibility •	Follow all major recruitment agencies and connect with recruiters in your field. •	Set up job alerts on their platforms. •	Email recruiters directly with a strong, well-crafted CV.Your job search isn’t just about applying—it’s about standing out!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#MiddleEastJobs hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SalaryNegotiation hashtag#RecruitmentTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#RiyadhJobs

The I’ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabi—ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, I’m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure you’re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:✅ Check Their License – Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.✅ Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder – Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agent’s profile and credentials before engaging.✅ Research Their Reputation – Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.✅ Work with Established Agencies – Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabi’s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.🚨 Red Flags to Avoid:❌ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisions❌ Deals that seem too good to be true❌ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contracts❌ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Client’s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isn’t just about choosing the right agent—it’s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlord’s office, thinking it will speed things up. But here’s the truth: a good agent can sense when they’re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do best—find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, you’ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

.أعلنت hashtag#هيئة_الطرق_و_المواصلات في دبي أن إجمالي عدد ركاب وسائل النقل الجماعي ومركبات الأجرة والتنقل المشترك خلال عطلة عيد الفطر المبارك 1446 هجرية 2025 ميلادية، (من 30 مارس وحتى 1 أبريل الجاري)، بلغ 6 ملايين و390 ألف راكب. وأوضحت الهيئة أن عدد ركاب المترو بخطيه الأحمر والأخضر، خلال العطلة، وصل إلى 2 مليون و427 ألف راكب، بينما بلغ عدد ركاب الترام 111,130 راكب، وعدد ركاب الحافلات العامة مليون و329 ألف راكب، ووصل عدد ركاب وسائل النقل البحري إلى 408 ألف راكب، ونقلت مركبات الأجرة (تاكسي دبي وشركات الامتياز) 1 مليون و686 ألف راكب، فيما سجلت أعداد ركاب التنقّل المشترك (والتي تشمل مركبات شركات التطبيقات الذكية ومركبات التأجير بالساعات والحافلات عند الطلب) 429,616 راكباً.لقراءة الخبر، تفضل بزيارة rta.aeDubai’s hashtag#RTA announced that the total number of passengers using public transport, taxis, and shared mobility services during the Eid Al-Fitr holiday 1446H / 2025 (from 30 March to 1 April) reached 6.390 million.The Dubai Metro, operating across both the Red and Green Lines, transported 2.428 million riders. Dubai Tram served 111,130 passengers, while public buses carried 1.330 million commuters.Marine transport services recorded 408,991 boardings, and taxis—including Dubai Taxi and franchise operators—served 1.687 million users. Shared mobility services—including e-hail vehicles, hourly car rentals, and on-demand buses—registered 429,616 riders across various platforms.To read the full news, please visit rta.ae

Job Market Insights from a Top Recruitment Agency in DubaiI recently had a discussion with a leading recruitment company hiring across the Middle East, and here are the key takeaways:✅ Salary ExpectationsFor Software Engineers with 5-6 years of experience (in strong tech stacks, the salary range provided to recruitment agencies is 20-30K SAR/month. However, your next salary increment will likely be based on your current pay. So, negotiate well—don’t settle for less!✅ Recruitment ProcessUnlike many Western markets, most companies here don’t use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems). Instead, recruiters manually review 8-10 resumes daily, meaning quality matters more than quantity.✅ Maximize Your Visibility •	Follow all major recruitment agencies and connect with recruiters in your field. •	Set up job alerts on their platforms. •	Email recruiters directly with a strong, well-crafted CV.Your job search isn’t just about applying—it’s about standing out!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#MiddleEastJobs hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SalaryNegotiation hashtag#RecruitmentTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#RiyadhJobs

The I’ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabi—ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, I’m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure you’re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:✅ Check Their License – Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.✅ Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder – Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agent’s profile and credentials before engaging.✅ Research Their Reputation – Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.✅ Work with Established Agencies – Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabi’s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.🚨 Red Flags to Avoid:❌ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisions❌ Deals that seem too good to be true❌ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contracts❌ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Client’s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isn’t just about choosing the right agent—it’s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlord’s office, thinking it will speed things up. But here’s the truth: a good agent can sense when they’re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do best—find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, you’ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

Dubai Tram served 111,130 passengers, while public buses carried 1.330 million commuters.Marine transport services recorded 408,991 boardings, and taxis—including Dubai Taxi and franchise operators—served 1.687 million users. Job Market Insights from a Top Recruitment Agency in DubaiI recently had a discussion with a leading recruitment company hiring across the Middle East, and here are the key takeaways:✅ Salary ExpectationsFor Software Engineers with 5-6 years of experience (in strong tech stacks, the salary range provided to recruitment agencies is 20-30K SAR/month. However, your next salary increment will likely be based on your current pay. So, negotiate well—don’t settle for less!✅ Recruitment ProcessUnlike many Western markets, most companies here don’t use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems). Instead, recruiters manually review 8-10 resumes daily, meaning quality matters more than quantity.✅ Maximize Your Visibility •	Follow all major recruitment agencies and connect with recruiters in your field. •	Set up job alerts on their platforms. •	Email recruiters directly with a strong, well-crafted CV.Your job search isn’t just about applying—it’s about standing out!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#MiddleEastJobs hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SalaryNegotiation hashtag#RecruitmentTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#RiyadhJobs

In the bustling metropolis of Dubai, the real estate sector continues to soar to new heights, much like the iconic Burj Khalifa piercing the sky. Last week, the market recorded a staggering $4.1 billion in transactions, showcasing the city's resilience and allure as a global investment hub.Between March 10 and March 14, a total of 3,726 sales transactions were documented, with sales dominating the figures at $3.1 billion. This remarkable activity reflects not just numbers, but the vibrant pulse of a city that never sleeps, where dreams are built brick by brick. Among the standout transactions, an office in Enara by Omniyat in Business Bay fetched an impressive AED 87.6 million ($23.8 million), while an apartment in Luxury Family Residence III also in Business Bay sold for AED 60.23 million ($16.4 million). These figures are not just statistics; they represent the aspirations of individuals and families seeking a slice of Dubai's luxurious lifestyle.Additionally, the Land Department reported mortgage deals worth AED 3.15 billion ($858 million) and gift transactions valued at AED 350 million ($95.3 million). This diverse range of transactions illustrates the multifaceted nature of the market, where investment opportunities abound and the spirit of giving flourishes.As we look ahead, the Dubai real estate sector is not just a market; it’s a beacon of opportunity, drawing investors from around the globe. The I’ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabi—ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, I’m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure you’re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:✅ Check Their License – Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.✅ Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder – Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agent’s profile and credentials before engaging.✅ Research Their Reputation – Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.✅ Work with Established Agencies – Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabi’s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.🚨 Red Flags to Avoid:❌ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisions❌ Deals that seem too good to be true❌ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contracts❌ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Client’s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isn’t just about choosing the right agent—it’s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlord’s office, thinking it will speed things up. But here’s the truth: a good agent can sense when they’re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do best—find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, you’ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

.أعلنت hashtag#هيئة_الطرق_و_المواصلات في دبي أن إجمالي عدد ركاب وسائل النقل الجماعي ومركبات الأجرة والتنقل المشترك خلال عطلة عيد الفطر المبارك 1446 هجرية 2025 ميلادية، (من 30 مارس وحتى 1 أبريل الجاري)، بلغ 6 ملايين و390 ألف راكب. وأوضحت الهيئة أن عدد ركاب المترو بخطيه الأحمر والأخضر، خلال العطلة، وصل إلى 2 مليون و427 ألف راكب، بينما بلغ عدد ركاب الترام 111,130 راكب، وعدد ركاب الحافلات العامة مليون و329 ألف راكب، ووصل عدد ركاب وسائل النقل البحري إلى 408 ألف راكب، ونقلت مركبات الأجرة (تاكسي دبي وشركات الامتياز) 1 مليون و686 ألف راكب، فيما سجلت أعداد ركاب التنقّل المشترك (والتي تشمل مركبات شركات التطبيقات الذكية ومركبات التأجير بالساعات والحافلات عند الطلب) 429,616 راكباً.لقراءة الخبر، تفضل بزيارة rta.aeDubai’s hashtag#RTA announced that the total number of passengers using public transport, taxis, and shared mobility services during the Eid Al-Fitr holiday 1446H / 2025 (from 30 March to 1 April) reached 6.390 million.The Dubai Metro, operating across both the Red and Green Lines, transported 2.428 million riders. Dubai Tram served 111,130 passengers, while public buses carried 1.330 million commuters.Marine transport services recorded 408,991 boardings, and taxis—including Dubai Taxi and franchise operators—served 1.687 million users. Shared mobility services—including e-hail vehicles, hourly car rentals, and on-demand buses—registered 429,616 riders across various platforms.To read the full news, please visit rta.ae

Job Market Insights from a Top Recruitment Agency in DubaiI recently had a discussion with a leading recruitment company hiring across the Middle East, and here are the key takeaways:✅ Salary ExpectationsFor Software Engineers with 5-6 years of experience (in strong tech stacks, the salary range provided to recruitment agencies is 20-30K SAR/month. However, your next salary increment will likely be based on your current pay. So, negotiate well—don’t settle for less!✅ Recruitment ProcessUnlike many Western markets, most companies here don’t use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems). Instead, recruiters manually review 8-10 resumes daily, meaning quality matters more than quantity.✅ Maximize Your Visibility •	Follow all major recruitment agencies and connect with recruiters in your field. •	Set up job alerts on their platforms. •	Email recruiters directly with a strong, well-crafted CV.Your job search isn’t just about applying—it’s about standing out!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#MiddleEastJobs hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SalaryNegotiation hashtag#RecruitmentTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#RiyadhJobs

In the bustling metropolis of Dubai, the real estate sector continues to soar to new heights, much like the iconic Burj Khalifa piercing the sky. Last week, the market recorded a staggering $4.1 billion in transactions, showcasing the city's resilience and allure as a global investment hub.Between March 10 and March 14, a total of 3,726 sales transactions were documented, with sales dominating the figures at $3.1 billion. This remarkable activity reflects not just numbers, but the vibrant pulse of a city that never sleeps, where dreams are built brick by brick. Among the standout transactions, an office in Enara by Omniyat in Business Bay fetched an impressive AED 87.6 million ($23.8 million), while an apartment in Luxury Family Residence III also in Business Bay sold for AED 60.23 million ($16.4 million). These figures are not just statistics; they represent the aspirations of individuals and families seeking a slice of Dubai's luxurious lifestyle.Additionally, the Land Department reported mortgage deals worth AED 3.15 billion ($858 million) and gift transactions valued at AED 350 million ($95.3 million). This diverse range of transactions illustrates the multifaceted nature of the market, where investment opportunities abound and the spirit of giving flourishes.As we look ahead, the Dubai real estate sector is not just a market; it’s a beacon of opportunity, drawing investors from around the globe. With its dynamic landscape and unwavering growth, Dubai continues to be a canvas where dreams are painted in vibrant colors, and the skyline is a testament to ambition and innovation.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#InvestmentOpportunities hashtag#GlobalHub hashtag#RealEstateMarket hashtag#BusinessBay hashtag#LuxuryLiving hashtag#GrowthMindset hashtag#Innovation hashtag#EconomicResilience

Leggere di un investimento così imponente nell’AI, come questo negli UAE, un paese che per decenni ha dimostrato che vige concretezza nella loro visione, non è solo il forte segnale che il futuro è già qui, è l’invito a ripensare al nostro modo di lavorare e vivere in un mondo che cambia ad un ritmo che anni fa sembrava inimmaginabile.E quel “anni fa” sta sempre più diventando un “mesi fa”, perché i cambiamenti drastici stanno sempre più avvenendo nel giro di mesi, non anni. L’AI ci sta chiaramente guardando in viso, e porgendo una mano. Una mano che ti stringe, e poi ti saluta, perché può prendere il tuo posto. Una mano che ti stringe, e poi ti supporta, perché un integratore al tuo potenziale.Si sono aperte e si stanno aprendo nuove sfide, nuove opportunità di crescita e trasformazione. La vera sfida qua, è farci trovare pronti, con mente aperta, visione e determinazione, per trasformare ogni cambiamento in un trampolino verso il futuro. The I’ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabi—ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, I’m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure you’re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:✅ Check Their License – Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.✅ Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder – Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agent’s profile and credentials before engaging.✅ Research Their Reputation – Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.✅ Work with Established Agencies – Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabi’s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.🚨 Red Flags to Avoid:❌ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisions❌ Deals that seem too good to be true❌ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contracts❌ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Client’s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isn’t just about choosing the right agent—it’s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlord’s office, thinking it will speed things up. But here’s the truth: a good agent can sense when they’re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do best—find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, you’ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

.أعلنت hashtag#هيئة_الطرق_و_المواصلات في دبي أن إجمالي عدد ركاب وسائل النقل الجماعي ومركبات الأجرة والتنقل المشترك خلال عطلة عيد الفطر المبارك 1446 هجرية 2025 ميلادية، (من 30 مارس وحتى 1 أبريل الجاري)، بلغ 6 ملايين و390 ألف راكب. وأوضحت الهيئة أن عدد ركاب المترو بخطيه الأحمر والأخضر، خلال العطلة، وصل إلى 2 مليون و427 ألف راكب، بينما بلغ عدد ركاب الترام 111,130 راكب، وعدد ركاب الحافلات العامة مليون و329 ألف راكب، ووصل عدد ركاب وسائل النقل البحري إلى 408 ألف راكب، ونقلت مركبات الأجرة (تاكسي دبي وشركات الامتياز) 1 مليون و686 ألف راكب، فيما سجلت أعداد ركاب التنقّل المشترك (والتي تشمل مركبات شركات التطبيقات الذكية ومركبات التأجير بالساعات والحافلات عند الطلب) 429,616 راكباً.لقراءة الخبر، تفضل بزيارة rta.aeDubai’s hashtag#RTA announced that the total number of passengers using public transport, taxis, and shared mobility services during the Eid Al-Fitr holiday 1446H / 2025 (from 30 March to 1 April) reached 6.390 million.The Dubai Metro, operating across both the Red and Green Lines, transported 2.428 million riders. Dubai Tram served 111,130 passengers, while public buses carried 1.330 million commuters.Marine transport services recorded 408,991 boardings, and taxis—including Dubai Taxi and franchise operators—served 1.687 million users. Shared mobility services—including e-hail vehicles, hourly car rentals, and on-demand buses—registered 429,616 riders across various platforms.To read the full news, please visit rta.ae

Job Market Insights from a Top Recruitment Agency in DubaiI recently had a discussion with a leading recruitment company hiring across the Middle East, and here are the key takeaways:✅ Salary ExpectationsFor Software Engineers with 5-6 years of experience (in strong tech stacks, the salary range provided to recruitment agencies is 20-30K SAR/month. However, your next salary increment will likely be based on your current pay. So, negotiate well—don’t settle for less!✅ Recruitment ProcessUnlike many Western markets, most companies here don’t use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems). Instead, recruiters manually review 8-10 resumes daily, meaning quality matters more than quantity.✅ Maximize Your Visibility •	Follow all major recruitment agencies and connect with recruiters in your field. •	Set up job alerts on their platforms. •	Email recruiters directly with a strong, well-crafted CV.Your job search isn’t just about applying—it’s about standing out!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#MiddleEastJobs hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SalaryNegotiation hashtag#RecruitmentTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#RiyadhJobs

As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the “Establishment”) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the “Emirate”).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the “Department”) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.

🧡 Freelance Exchange taught me a lot. Here's the honest part.Over the last 10 years, I’ve worked as both a freelancer and someone hiring freelancers — especially from equity-deserving communities. And while I love freelancing (and freelancers), this dual perspective has shown me just how often our expectations miss each other.We built Freelance Exchange with Good Growth Hub to bridge this gap. 📎 You can read the full case study via Local Champions CIC (reshared below) — but today I want to be honest about the hard truths: the ones we often don’t say out loud — about working across power, pressure, and people’s real lives.My first freelance job was in 2014. Since then, I’ve built a six-figure consultancy career and run Local Champions CIC — a social enterprise and international consultancy working across the UK and Rwanda.I’ve also hired & managed over 30 freelancers in the last five years.Here’s the truth: it’s still one of the hardest things I do.Not because freelancers are difficult — but because the relationship between freelancers & employers, especially in small orgs like ours, is rarely discussed with the mutual understanding it deserves.What employers need to understand about freelancers:🫀 Life happens — family, mental health, burnout. I’ve missed deadlines too. What matters is honest communication. I’ve been lucky to work with partners like A New Direction who led with care, not punishment.⚖️ Many freelancers face systemic inequality. Equity is not charity. Building systems of access and support is justice.📚 Clear briefs unlock better work. Employers must scope well, pay on time, and model professionalism.💡 Invest early — and freelancers often over-deliver long-term.What freelancers need to understand about employers:💸 Budgeting for you matters — especially in small orgs. We hire instead of paying ourselves. If you want fair pay, remember: delivery and communication are part of that fairness.⏳ Missed deadlines cost more than time — they break trust. One late task can derail reports, delay programmes, or damage partnerships.📣 Communication isn’t optional — it’s part of the job. Up-managing is a superpower. The best freelancers check in, clarify, and flag risks early.🧠 Understanding how public/third sector employers work gives you an edge.📑 Deposits and contracts are valid — but so is delivery. You can’t expect full payment for half-complete work.The future of work needs both sides to do better.And we can — with honesty, shared values, and radical collaboration.🧡 Deep gratitude to every freelancer, partner, funder, and teammate who shaped this work. Let’s keep building better, together.✨ Freelancers deserve more than gigs. ✨ Employers deserve more than stress. 🧡 Together, we can build environments where both sides win.🔗 Case study @LocalChampionsCIC hashtag#FreelanceExchange hashtag#WeMakeChampions hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#Freelancers hashtag#InclusiveInnovation hashtag#SystemsChange hashtag#Entrepreneurship hashtag#LocalChampions

The I’ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabi—ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, I’m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure you’re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:✅ Check Their License – Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.✅ Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder – Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agent’s profile and credentials before engaging.✅ Research Their Reputation – Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.✅ Work with Established Agencies – Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabi’s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.🚨 Red Flags to Avoid:❌ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisions❌ Deals that seem too good to be true❌ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contracts❌ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Client’s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isn’t just about choosing the right agent—it’s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlord’s office, thinking it will speed things up. But here’s the truth: a good agent can sense when they’re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do best—find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, you’ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

.أعلنت hashtag#هيئة_الطرق_و_المواصلات في دبي أن إجمالي عدد ركاب وسائل النقل الجماعي ومركبات الأجرة والتنقل المشترك خلال عطلة عيد الفطر المبارك 1446 هجرية 2025 ميلادية، (من 30 مارس وحتى 1 أبريل الجاري)، بلغ 6 ملايين و390 ألف راكب. وأوضحت الهيئة أن عدد ركاب المترو بخطيه الأحمر والأخضر، خلال العطلة، وصل إلى 2 مليون و427 ألف راكب، بينما بلغ عدد ركاب الترام 111,130 راكب، وعدد ركاب الحافلات العامة مليون و329 ألف راكب، ووصل عدد ركاب وسائل النقل البحري إلى 408 ألف راكب، ونقلت مركبات الأجرة (تاكسي دبي وشركات الامتياز) 1 مليون و686 ألف راكب، فيما سجلت أعداد ركاب التنقّل المشترك (والتي تشمل مركبات شركات التطبيقات الذكية ومركبات التأجير بالساعات والحافلات عند الطلب) 429,616 راكباً.لقراءة الخبر، تفضل بزيارة rta.aeDubai’s hashtag#RTA announced that the total number of passengers using public transport, taxis, and shared mobility services during the Eid Al-Fitr holiday 1446H / 2025 (from 30 March to 1 April) reached 6.390 million.The Dubai Metro, operating across both the Red and Green Lines, transported 2.428 million riders. Dubai Tram served 111,130 passengers, while public buses carried 1.330 million commuters.Marine transport services recorded 408,991 boardings, and taxis—including Dubai Taxi and franchise operators—served 1.687 million users. Shared mobility services—including e-hail vehicles, hourly car rentals, and on-demand buses—registered 429,616 riders across various platforms.To read the full news, please visit rta.ae

Job Market Insights from a Top Recruitment Agency in DubaiI recently had a discussion with a leading recruitment company hiring across the Middle East, and here are the key takeaways:✅ Salary ExpectationsFor Software Engineers with 5-6 years of experience (in strong tech stacks, the salary range provided to recruitment agencies is 20-30K SAR/month. However, your next salary increment will likely be based on your current pay. So, negotiate well—don’t settle for less!✅ Recruitment ProcessUnlike many Western markets, most companies here don’t use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems). Instead, recruiters manually review 8-10 resumes daily, meaning quality matters more than quantity.✅ Maximize Your Visibility •	Follow all major recruitment agencies and connect with recruiters in your field. •	Set up job alerts on their platforms. •	Email recruiters directly with a strong, well-crafted CV.Your job search isn’t just about applying—it’s about standing out!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#MiddleEastJobs hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SalaryNegotiation hashtag#RecruitmentTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#RiyadhJobs

In the bustling metropolis of Dubai, the real estate sector continues to soar to new heights, much like the iconic Burj Khalifa piercing the sky. Last week, the market recorded a staggering $4.1 billion in transactions, showcasing the city's resilience and allure as a global investment hub.Between March 10 and March 14, a total of 3,726 sales transactions were documented, with sales dominating the figures at $3.1 billion. This remarkable activity reflects not just numbers, but the vibrant pulse of a city that never sleeps, where dreams are built brick by brick. Among the standout transactions, an office in Enara by Omniyat in Business Bay fetched an impressive AED 87.6 million ($23.8 million), while an apartment in Luxury Family Residence III also in Business Bay sold for AED 60.23 million ($16.4 million). These figures are not just statistics; they represent the aspirations of individuals and families seeking a slice of Dubai's luxurious lifestyle.Additionally, the Land Department reported mortgage deals worth AED 3.15 billion ($858 million) and gift transactions valued at AED 350 million ($95.3 million). This diverse range of transactions illustrates the multifaceted nature of the market, where investment opportunities abound and the spirit of giving flourishes.As we look ahead, the Dubai real estate sector is not just a market; it’s a beacon of opportunity, drawing investors from around the globe. Una mano che ti stringe, e poi ti supporta, perché un integratore al tuo potenziale.Si sono aperte e si stanno aprendo nuove sfide, nuove opportunità di crescita e trasformazione. La vera sfida qua, è farci trovare pronti, con mente aperta, visione e determinazione, per trasformare ogni cambiamento in un trampolino verso il futuro. Ed anche se un giorno un robot dovesse portarci il caffè senza muovere un dito, saremo, e dovremo, essere sempre noi a deciderne gusto, intensità, e concezione.E tu in ciò, che sfida stai affrontando?hashtag#AI hashtag#UAE hashtag#Innovazione hashtag#Investimenti hashtag#Crescita

As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the “Establishment”) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the “Emirate”).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the “Department”) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.

🧡 Freelance Exchange taught me a lot. Here's the honest part.Over the last 10 years, I’ve worked as both a freelancer and someone hiring freelancers — especially from equity-deserving communities. And while I love freelancing (and freelancers), this dual perspective has shown me just how often our expectations miss each other.We built Freelance Exchange with Good Growth Hub to bridge this gap. 📎 You can read the full case study via Local Champions CIC (reshared below) — but today I want to be honest about the hard truths: the ones we often don’t say out loud — about working across power, pressure, and people’s real lives.My first freelance job was in 2014. Since then, I’ve built a six-figure consultancy career and run Local Champions CIC — a social enterprise and international consultancy working across the UK and Rwanda.I’ve also hired & managed over 30 freelancers in the last five years.Here’s the truth: it’s still one of the hardest things I do.Not because freelancers are difficult — but because the relationship between freelancers & employers, especially in small orgs like ours, is rarely discussed with the mutual understanding it deserves.What employers need to understand about freelancers:🫀 Life happens — family, mental health, burnout. I’ve missed deadlines too. What matters is honest communication. I’ve been lucky to work with partners like A New Direction who led with care, not punishment.⚖️ Many freelancers face systemic inequality. Equity is not charity. Building systems of access and support is justice.📚 Clear briefs unlock better work. Employers must scope well, pay on time, and model professionalism.💡 Invest early — and freelancers often over-deliver long-term.What freelancers need to understand about employers:💸 Budgeting for you matters — especially in small orgs. We hire instead of paying ourselves. If you want fair pay, remember: delivery and communication are part of that fairness.⏳ Missed deadlines cost more than time — they break trust. One late task can derail reports, delay programmes, or damage partnerships.📣 Communication isn’t optional — it’s part of the job. Up-managing is a superpower. The best freelancers check in, clarify, and flag risks early.🧠 Understanding how public/third sector employers work gives you an edge.📑 Deposits and contracts are valid — but so is delivery. You can’t expect full payment for half-complete work.The future of work needs both sides to do better.And we can — with honesty, shared values, and radical collaboration.🧡 Deep gratitude to every freelancer, partner, funder, and teammate who shaped this work. Let’s keep building better, together.✨ Freelancers deserve more than gigs. ✨ Employers deserve more than stress. 🧡 Together, we can build environments where both sides win.🔗 Case study @LocalChampionsCIC hashtag#FreelanceExchange hashtag#WeMakeChampions hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#Freelancers hashtag#InclusiveInnovation hashtag#SystemsChange hashtag#Entrepreneurship hashtag#LocalChampions

The I’ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabi—ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, I’m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure you’re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:✅ Check Their License – Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.✅ Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder – Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agent’s profile and credentials before engaging.✅ Research Their Reputation – Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.✅ Work with Established Agencies – Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabi’s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.🚨 Red Flags to Avoid:❌ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisions❌ Deals that seem too good to be true❌ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contracts❌ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Client’s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isn’t just about choosing the right agent—it’s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlord’s office, thinking it will speed things up. But here’s the truth: a good agent can sense when they’re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do best—find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, you’ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

.أعلنت hashtag#هيئة_الطرق_و_المواصلات في دبي أن إجمالي عدد ركاب وسائل النقل الجماعي ومركبات الأجرة والتنقل المشترك خلال عطلة عيد الفطر المبارك 1446 هجرية 2025 ميلادية، (من 30 مارس وحتى 1 أبريل الجاري)، بلغ 6 ملايين و390 ألف راكب. وأوضحت الهيئة أن عدد ركاب المترو بخطيه الأحمر والأخضر، خلال العطلة، وصل إلى 2 مليون و427 ألف راكب، بينما بلغ عدد ركاب الترام 111,130 راكب، وعدد ركاب الحافلات العامة مليون و329 ألف راكب، ووصل عدد ركاب وسائل النقل البحري إلى 408 ألف راكب، ونقلت مركبات الأجرة (تاكسي دبي وشركات الامتياز) 1 مليون و686 ألف راكب، فيما سجلت أعداد ركاب التنقّل المشترك (والتي تشمل مركبات شركات التطبيقات الذكية ومركبات التأجير بالساعات والحافلات عند الطلب) 429,616 راكباً.لقراءة الخبر، تفضل بزيارة rta.aeDubai’s hashtag#RTA announced that the total number of passengers using public transport, taxis, and shared mobility services during the Eid Al-Fitr holiday 1446H / 2025 (from 30 March to 1 April) reached 6.390 million.The Dubai Metro, operating across both the Red and Green Lines, transported 2.428 million riders. Dubai Tram served 111,130 passengers, while public buses carried 1.330 million commuters.Marine transport services recorded 408,991 boardings, and taxis—including Dubai Taxi and franchise operators—served 1.687 million users. Shared mobility services—including e-hail vehicles, hourly car rentals, and on-demand buses—registered 429,616 riders across various platforms.To read the full news, please visit rta.ae

Job Market Insights from a Top Recruitment Agency in DubaiI recently had a discussion with a leading recruitment company hiring across the Middle East, and here are the key takeaways:✅ Salary ExpectationsFor Software Engineers with 5-6 years of experience (in strong tech stacks, the salary range provided to recruitment agencies is 20-30K SAR/month. However, your next salary increment will likely be based on your current pay. So, negotiate well—don’t settle for less!✅ Recruitment ProcessUnlike many Western markets, most companies here don’t use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems). Instead, recruiters manually review 8-10 resumes daily, meaning quality matters more than quantity.✅ Maximize Your Visibility •	Follow all major recruitment agencies and connect with recruiters in your field. •	Set up job alerts on their platforms. •	Email recruiters directly with a strong, well-crafted CV.Your job search isn’t just about applying—it’s about standing out!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#MiddleEastJobs hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SalaryNegotiation hashtag#RecruitmentTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#RiyadhJobs

In the bustling metropolis of Dubai, the real estate sector continues to soar to new heights, much like the iconic Burj Khalifa piercing the sky. Last week, the market recorded a staggering $4.1 billion in transactions, showcasing the city's resilience and allure as a global investment hub.Between March 10 and March 14, a total of 3,726 sales transactions were documented, with sales dominating the figures at $3.1 billion. This remarkable activity reflects not just numbers, but the vibrant pulse of a city that never sleeps, where dreams are built brick by brick. Among the standout transactions, an office in Enara by Omniyat in Business Bay fetched an impressive AED 87.6 million ($23.8 million), while an apartment in Luxury Family Residence III also in Business Bay sold for AED 60.23 million ($16.4 million). These figures are not just statistics; they represent the aspirations of individuals and families seeking a slice of Dubai's luxurious lifestyle.Additionally, the Land Department reported mortgage deals worth AED 3.15 billion ($858 million) and gift transactions valued at AED 350 million ($95.3 million). This diverse range of transactions illustrates the multifaceted nature of the market, where investment opportunities abound and the spirit of giving flourishes.As we look ahead, the Dubai real estate sector is not just a market; it’s a beacon of opportunity, drawing investors from around the globe. As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the “Establishment”) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the “Emirate”).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the “Department”) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.

🧡 Freelance Exchange taught me a lot. Here's the honest part.Over the last 10 years, I’ve worked as both a freelancer and someone hiring freelancers — especially from equity-deserving communities. And while I love freelancing (and freelancers), this dual perspective has shown me just how often our expectations miss each other.We built Freelance Exchange with Good Growth Hub to bridge this gap. 📎 You can read the full case study via Local Champions CIC (reshared below) — but today I want to be honest about the hard truths: the ones we often don’t say out loud — about working across power, pressure, and people’s real lives.My first freelance job was in 2014. Since then, I’ve built a six-figure consultancy career and run Local Champions CIC — a social enterprise and international consultancy working across the UK and Rwanda.I’ve also hired & managed over 30 freelancers in the last five years.Here’s the truth: it’s still one of the hardest things I do.Not because freelancers are difficult — but because the relationship between freelancers & employers, especially in small orgs like ours, is rarely discussed with the mutual understanding it deserves.What employers need to understand about freelancers:🫀 Life happens — family, mental health, burnout. I’ve missed deadlines too. What matters is honest communication. I’ve been lucky to work with partners like A New Direction who led with care, not punishment.⚖️ Many freelancers face systemic inequality. Equity is not charity. Building systems of access and support is justice.📚 Clear briefs unlock better work. Employers must scope well, pay on time, and model professionalism.💡 Invest early — and freelancers often over-deliver long-term.What freelancers need to understand about employers:💸 Budgeting for you matters — especially in small orgs. We hire instead of paying ourselves. If you want fair pay, remember: delivery and communication are part of that fairness.⏳ Missed deadlines cost more than time — they break trust. One late task can derail reports, delay programmes, or damage partnerships.📣 Communication isn’t optional — it’s part of the job. Up-managing is a superpower. The best freelancers check in, clarify, and flag risks early.🧠 Understanding how public/third sector employers work gives you an edge.📑 Deposits and contracts are valid — but so is delivery. You can’t expect full payment for half-complete work.The future of work needs both sides to do better.And we can — with honesty, shared values, and radical collaboration.🧡 Deep gratitude to every freelancer, partner, funder, and teammate who shaped this work. Let’s keep building better, together.✨ Freelancers deserve more than gigs. ✨ Employers deserve more than stress. 🧡 Together, we can build environments where both sides win.🔗 Case study @LocalChampionsCIC hashtag#FreelanceExchange hashtag#WeMakeChampions hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#Freelancers hashtag#InclusiveInnovation hashtag#SystemsChange hashtag#Entrepreneurship hashtag#LocalChampions
