🧡 Freelance Exchange taught me a lot. Here's the honest part.Over the last 10 years, I’ve worked as both a freelancer and someone hiring freelancers — especially from equity-deserving communities. And while I love freelancing (and freelancers), this dual perspective has shown me just how often our expectations miss each other.We built Freelance Exchange with Good Growth Hub to bridge this gap. 📎 You can read the full case study via Local Champions CIC (reshared below) — but today I want to be honest about the hard truths: the ones we often don’t say out loud — about working across power, pressure, and people’s real lives.My first freelance job was in 2014. Since then, I’ve built a six-figure consultancy career and run Local Champions CIC — a social enterprise and international consultancy working across the UK and Rwanda.I’ve also hired & managed over 30 freelancers in the last five years.Here’s the truth: it’s still one of the hardest things I do.Not because freelancers are difficult — but because the relationship between freelancers & employers, especially in small orgs like ours, is rarely discussed with the mutual understanding it deserves.What employers need to understand about freelancers:🫀 Life happens — family, mental health, burnout. I’ve missed deadlines too. What matters is honest communication. I’ve been lucky to work with partners like A New Direction who led with care, not punishment.⚖️ Many freelancers face systemic inequality. Equity is not charity. Building systems of access and support is justice.📚 Clear briefs unlock better work. Employers must scope well, pay on time, and model professionalism.💡 Invest early — and freelancers often over-deliver long-term.What freelancers need to understand about employers:💸 Budgeting for you matters — especially in small orgs. We hire instead of paying ourselves. If you want fair pay, remember: delivery and communication are part of that fairness.⏳ Missed deadlines cost more than time — they break trust. One late task can derail reports, delay programmes, or damage partnerships.📣 Communication isn’t optional — it’s part of the job. Up-managing is a superpower. The best freelancers check in, clarify, and flag risks early.🧠 Understanding how public/third sector employers work gives you an edge.📑 Deposits and contracts are valid — but so is delivery. You can’t expect full payment for half-complete work.The future of work needs both sides to do better.And we can — with honesty, shared values, and radical collaboration.🧡 Deep gratitude to every freelancer, partner, funder, and teammate who shaped this work. Let’s keep building better, together.✨ Freelancers deserve more than gigs. ✨ Employers deserve more than stress. 🧡 Together, we can build environments where both sides win.🔗 Case study @LocalChampionsCIC hashtag#FreelanceExchange hashtag#WeMakeChampions hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#Freelancers hashtag#InclusiveInnovation hashtag#SystemsChange hashtag#Entrepreneurship hashtag#LocalChampions

With its progressed Aquarius Sun conjunct North Node and Pluto - trined by natal Libra Pluto - the city's destiny is to balance power with fairness, innovation with social responsibility. This alignment calls for equitable wealth distribution, futuristic governance, and a shift from exclusivity to inclusivity. 🚀 Project Kick-Off Meeting: Setting the Tone for SuccessA well-structured kick-off meeting is more than just a formality—it's the foundation for project alignment, transparency, and momentum. In the UAE's fast-paced construction and development landscape, these meetings are critical to ensuring all parties start on the same page.Here’s what must be acknowledged and aligned during a successful kick-off:✅ Project Scope & Deliverables All stakeholders must acknowledge the full scope, key milestones, and final deliverables—ensuring clarity and avoiding scope creep.✅ Roles & Responsibilities Clear acknowledgment of each party’s responsibilities is essential—Client, Consultant, Contractor, and Subcontractors must know their deliverables and lines of communication.✅ Communication Protocols Agree on reporting structures, meeting frequencies, documentation standards, and escalation procedures.✅ Program & Milestones A preliminary project timeline should be presented, with agreement on the critical path, early deliverables, and long lead items.✅ Design & Engineering Submissions Clarification on submission timelines, review durations, and authority approval requirements (e.g., DM, DDA, Trakhees, etc.).✅ HSE & Quality Expectations Align on the project's health, safety, and quality standards from Day 1—including permits, inductions, and inspection/test procedures.✅ Risk & Opportunities Discuss known project risks and mitigation strategies early—openness now prevents surprises later.✅ Authority Regulations & NOC Dependencies All parties must acknowledge the local authority framework, timelines, and third-party dependencies critical to project success in the UAE.A successful kick-off is not just about starting—it's about setting a culture of accountability, collaboration, and shared goals.💬 Have you attended a project kick-off recently? The I’ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabi—ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, I’m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure you’re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:✅ Check Their License – Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.✅ Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder – Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agent’s profile and credentials before engaging.✅ Research Their Reputation – Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.✅ Work with Established Agencies – Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabi’s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.🚨 Red Flags to Avoid:❌ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisions❌ Deals that seem too good to be true❌ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contracts❌ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Client’s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isn’t just about choosing the right agent—it’s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlord’s office, thinking it will speed things up. But here’s the truth: a good agent can sense when they’re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do best—find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, you’ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

.أعلنت hashtag#هيئة_الطرق_و_المواصلات في دبي أن إجمالي عدد ركاب وسائل النقل الجماعي ومركبات الأجرة والتنقل المشترك خلال عطلة عيد الفطر المبارك 1446 هجرية 2025 ميلادية، (من 30 مارس وحتى 1 أبريل الجاري)، بلغ 6 ملايين و390 ألف راكب. وأوضحت الهيئة أن عدد ركاب المترو بخطيه الأحمر والأخضر، خلال العطلة، وصل إلى 2 مليون و427 ألف راكب، بينما بلغ عدد ركاب الترام 111,130 راكب، وعدد ركاب الحافلات العامة مليون و329 ألف راكب، ووصل عدد ركاب وسائل النقل البحري إلى 408 ألف راكب، ونقلت مركبات الأجرة (تاكسي دبي وشركات الامتياز) 1 مليون و686 ألف راكب، فيما سجلت أعداد ركاب التنقّل المشترك (والتي تشمل مركبات شركات التطبيقات الذكية ومركبات التأجير بالساعات والحافلات عند الطلب) 429,616 راكباً.لقراءة الخبر، تفضل بزيارة rta.aeDubai’s hashtag#RTA announced that the total number of passengers using public transport, taxis, and shared mobility services during the Eid Al-Fitr holiday 1446H / 2025 (from 30 March to 1 April) reached 6.390 million.The Dubai Metro, operating across both the Red and Green Lines, transported 2.428 million riders. Dubai Tram served 111,130 passengers, while public buses carried 1.330 million commuters.Marine transport services recorded 408,991 boardings, and taxis—including Dubai Taxi and franchise operators—served 1.687 million users. Shared mobility services—including e-hail vehicles, hourly car rentals, and on-demand buses—registered 429,616 riders across various platforms.To read the full news, please visit rta.ae

Job Market Insights from a Top Recruitment Agency in DubaiI recently had a discussion with a leading recruitment company hiring across the Middle East, and here are the key takeaways:✅ Salary ExpectationsFor Software Engineers with 5-6 years of experience (in strong tech stacks, the salary range provided to recruitment agencies is 20-30K SAR/month. However, your next salary increment will likely be based on your current pay. So, negotiate well—don’t settle for less!✅ Recruitment ProcessUnlike many Western markets, most companies here don’t use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems). Instead, recruiters manually review 8-10 resumes daily, meaning quality matters more than quantity.✅ Maximize Your Visibility •	Follow all major recruitment agencies and connect with recruiters in your field. •	Set up job alerts on their platforms. •	Email recruiters directly with a strong, well-crafted CV.Your job search isn’t just about applying—it’s about standing out!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#MiddleEastJobs hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SalaryNegotiation hashtag#RecruitmentTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#RiyadhJobs

In the bustling metropolis of Dubai, the real estate sector continues to soar to new heights, much like the iconic Burj Khalifa piercing the sky. Last week, the market recorded a staggering $4.1 billion in transactions, showcasing the city's resilience and allure as a global investment hub.Between March 10 and March 14, a total of 3,726 sales transactions were documented, with sales dominating the figures at $3.1 billion. Among the standout transactions, an office in Enara by Omniyat in Business Bay fetched an impressive AED 87.6 million ($23.8 million), while an apartment in Luxury Family Residence III also in Business Bay sold for AED 60.23 million ($16.4 million). These figures are not just statistics; they represent the aspirations of individuals and families seeking a slice of Dubai's luxurious lifestyle.Additionally, the Land Department reported mortgage deals worth AED 3.15 billion ($858 million) and gift transactions valued at AED 350 million ($95.3 million). This diverse range of transactions illustrates the multifaceted nature of the market, where investment opportunities abound and the spirit of giving flourishes.As we look ahead, the Dubai real estate sector is not just a market; it’s a beacon of opportunity, drawing investors from around the globe. As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the “Establishment”) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the “Emirate”).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the “Department”) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.

🧡 Freelance Exchange taught me a lot. Here's the honest part.Over the last 10 years, I’ve worked as both a freelancer and someone hiring freelancers — especially from equity-deserving communities. And while I love freelancing (and freelancers), this dual perspective has shown me just how often our expectations miss each other.We built Freelance Exchange with Good Growth Hub to bridge this gap. 📎 You can read the full case study via Local Champions CIC (reshared below) — but today I want to be honest about the hard truths: the ones we often don’t say out loud — about working across power, pressure, and people’s real lives.My first freelance job was in 2014. Since then, I’ve built a six-figure consultancy career and run Local Champions CIC — a social enterprise and international consultancy working across the UK and Rwanda.I’ve also hired & managed over 30 freelancers in the last five years.Here’s the truth: it’s still one of the hardest things I do.Not because freelancers are difficult — but because the relationship between freelancers & employers, especially in small orgs like ours, is rarely discussed with the mutual understanding it deserves.What employers need to understand about freelancers:🫀 Life happens — family, mental health, burnout. I’ve missed deadlines too. What matters is honest communication. I’ve been lucky to work with partners like A New Direction who led with care, not punishment.⚖️ Many freelancers face systemic inequality. Equity is not charity. Building systems of access and support is justice.📚 Clear briefs unlock better work. Employers must scope well, pay on time, and model professionalism.💡 Invest early — and freelancers often over-deliver long-term.What freelancers need to understand about employers:💸 Budgeting for you matters — especially in small orgs. We hire instead of paying ourselves. If you want fair pay, remember: delivery and communication are part of that fairness.⏳ Missed deadlines cost more than time — they break trust. One late task can derail reports, delay programmes, or damage partnerships.📣 Communication isn’t optional — it’s part of the job. Up-managing is a superpower. The best freelancers check in, clarify, and flag risks early.🧠 Understanding how public/third sector employers work gives you an edge.📑 Deposits and contracts are valid — but so is delivery. You can’t expect full payment for half-complete work.The future of work needs both sides to do better.And we can — with honesty, shared values, and radical collaboration.🧡 Deep gratitude to every freelancer, partner, funder, and teammate who shaped this work. Let’s keep building better, together.✨ Freelancers deserve more than gigs. ✨ Employers deserve more than stress. 🧡 Together, we can build environments where both sides win.🔗 Case study @LocalChampionsCIC hashtag#FreelanceExchange hashtag#WeMakeChampions hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#Freelancers hashtag#InclusiveInnovation hashtag#SystemsChange hashtag#Entrepreneurship hashtag#LocalChampions

𝕋𝕠𝕠 𝕄𝕒𝕟𝕪 𝔹𝕚𝕘 𝔽𝕚𝕤𝕙 𝕀𝕟 𝔸 𝕊𝕞𝕒𝕝𝕝 ℙ𝕠𝕟𝕕? - hashtag#ENERGY analysis of SOME of Dubai's future prospects, from a critical thinking Energy GuideDisclaimer: My research is energy based and I explore many fascets, avenues to give a BALANCED viewpoint as a NEUTRAL observer. I wish to see EVERYONE WIN!2024 figures show 66.97m hashtag#UK residents - with ~4.55% of them millionaires. This figure is projected to decline to 3.62% by 2028. Factors contributing to this are changes in tax policies: abolition of the non-domiciled tax status, and a culture perceived as hostile to wealth creators - UK's transit chart is showing this clearly.Compare this to 3.82m hashtag#Dubai residents with ~72,5k millionaires, about 1.9%.​ The wealth of Dubai's royal family has an estimated net worth of $18bn. So we are talking big! A member on here wrote that one needs MINIMUM 10m nowadays to feel secure - but in Dubai? Even the underworld packs $1.5bn. So wealth is concentrated in the hands of the few - in a small pond.So I pulled up Dubai's chart. HE is MASCULINE 80% Yang, mutable 80% and fire dominant: basically a Sagittarius. Natally (1st pic) has Sagittarius Neptune, Sun, Jupiter, Mercury - in line with the welcoming, international melting pot of different cultures, stimulating environment, relaxed taxation image. Aries Neptune transit will further enhance this, but the Libra Pluto opposition (and other transits) will challenge it too. Sagittarius energy, while visionary, can also be dogmatic with rigid ideological structures that cover up deeper systemic issues. The “bigger is better” mindset can reveal cracks in the foundation of long-term stability. In progressed (2nd pic) the tension is between a strong T-sqare, and a fainter blue grand air trine - Aquarius Sun conjunct North Node (destiny) trine Libra Pluto Rx and Gemini Saturn Rx. Mars (action, drive) long progressed from spiritual warrior Pisces into hands-on, determined Aries warrior.I also see (3rd pic) a beautiful Pluto-Pluto trine on top of the Aquarius Sun, North Node combo: that is creating a national identity based on real Aquarian principles - coexisting in harmony and respecting differences. The road there will require a powerhouse of strategic intellect, sharp decision-making, and disruptive insight: the apex of the T-square is that Capricorn Mercury.For Dubai to achieve true Aquarian harmony, it must embrace radical transparency, decentralized power structures, and collective progress. With its progressed Aquarius Sun conjunct North Node and Pluto - trined by natal Libra Pluto - the city's destiny is to balance power with fairness, innovation with social responsibility. This alignment calls for equitable wealth distribution, futuristic governance, and a shift from exclusivity to inclusivity. By integrating cutting-edge technology with ethical reform, Dubai can emerge as a true beacon of progressive leadership in the new era.

🚀 Project Kick-Off Meeting: Setting the Tone for SuccessA well-structured kick-off meeting is more than just a formality—it's the foundation for project alignment, transparency, and momentum. In the UAE's fast-paced construction and development landscape, these meetings are critical to ensuring all parties start on the same page.Here’s what must be acknowledged and aligned during a successful kick-off:✅ Project Scope & Deliverables All stakeholders must acknowledge the full scope, key milestones, and final deliverables—ensuring clarity and avoiding scope creep.✅ Roles & Responsibilities Clear acknowledgment of each party’s responsibilities is essential—Client, Consultant, Contractor, and Subcontractors must know their deliverables and lines of communication.✅ Communication Protocols Agree on reporting structures, meeting frequencies, documentation standards, and escalation procedures.✅ Program & Milestones A preliminary project timeline should be presented, with agreement on the critical path, early deliverables, and long lead items.✅ Design & Engineering Submissions Clarification on submission timelines, review durations, and authority approval requirements (e.g., DM, DDA, Trakhees, etc.).✅ HSE & Quality Expectations Align on the project's health, safety, and quality standards from Day 1—including permits, inductions, and inspection/test procedures.✅ Risk & Opportunities Discuss known project risks and mitigation strategies early—openness now prevents surprises later.✅ Authority Regulations & NOC Dependencies All parties must acknowledge the local authority framework, timelines, and third-party dependencies critical to project success in the UAE.A successful kick-off is not just about starting—it's about setting a culture of accountability, collaboration, and shared goals.💬 Have you attended a project kick-off recently? Understanding ROI in Dubai's Real Estate MarketROI (Return on Investment) is a key metric in real estate that measures the profitability of a property. In Dubai, ROI is typically calculated as:📌 ROI (%) = (Annual Rental Income ÷ Property Purchase Price) × 100Dubai is known for its high rental yields, often ranging between 5% to 9%, depending on the location, property type, and market conditions. Factors influencing ROI include:✅ Location – Prime areas like Dubai Marina, Downtown, and Business Bay yield higher returns.✅ Property Type – Short-term rentals & furnished units often generate better returns.✅ Market Demand – High tourism & expat population drive rental demand.✅ Government Policies – Investor-friendly regulations & tax-free rental income boost profitability.Vipin Sharma Coldwell Banker UAE | Mega Homes Real Estate Brokers LLC Ilyas Elachari Laura Marcela Cantillo Meza Soumya Kalani Atul Mohan Tesfai A. The I’ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabi—ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, I’m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure you’re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:✅ Check Their License – Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.✅ Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder – Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agent’s profile and credentials before engaging.✅ Research Their Reputation – Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.✅ Work with Established Agencies – Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabi’s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.🚨 Red Flags to Avoid:❌ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisions❌ Deals that seem too good to be true❌ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contracts❌ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Client’s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isn’t just about choosing the right agent—it’s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlord’s office, thinking it will speed things up. But here’s the truth: a good agent can sense when they’re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do best—find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, you’ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

.أعلنت hashtag#هيئة_الطرق_و_المواصلات في دبي أن إجمالي عدد ركاب وسائل النقل الجماعي ومركبات الأجرة والتنقل المشترك خلال عطلة عيد الفطر المبارك 1446 هجرية 2025 ميلادية، (من 30 مارس وحتى 1 أبريل الجاري)، بلغ 6 ملايين و390 ألف راكب. وأوضحت الهيئة أن عدد ركاب المترو بخطيه الأحمر والأخضر، خلال العطلة، وصل إلى 2 مليون و427 ألف راكب، بينما بلغ عدد ركاب الترام 111,130 راكب، وعدد ركاب الحافلات العامة مليون و329 ألف راكب، ووصل عدد ركاب وسائل النقل البحري إلى 408 ألف راكب، ونقلت مركبات الأجرة (تاكسي دبي وشركات الامتياز) 1 مليون و686 ألف راكب، فيما سجلت أعداد ركاب التنقّل المشترك (والتي تشمل مركبات شركات التطبيقات الذكية ومركبات التأجير بالساعات والحافلات عند الطلب) 429,616 راكباً.لقراءة الخبر، تفضل بزيارة rta.aeDubai’s hashtag#RTA announced that the total number of passengers using public transport, taxis, and shared mobility services during the Eid Al-Fitr holiday 1446H / 2025 (from 30 March to 1 April) reached 6.390 million.The Dubai Metro, operating across both the Red and Green Lines, transported 2.428 million riders. Dubai Tram served 111,130 passengers, while public buses carried 1.330 million commuters.Marine transport services recorded 408,991 boardings, and taxis—including Dubai Taxi and franchise operators—served 1.687 million users. Shared mobility services—including e-hail vehicles, hourly car rentals, and on-demand buses—registered 429,616 riders across various platforms.To read the full news, please visit rta.ae

Job Market Insights from a Top Recruitment Agency in DubaiI recently had a discussion with a leading recruitment company hiring across the Middle East, and here are the key takeaways:✅ Salary ExpectationsFor Software Engineers with 5-6 years of experience (in strong tech stacks, the salary range provided to recruitment agencies is 20-30K SAR/month. However, your next salary increment will likely be based on your current pay. So, negotiate well—don’t settle for less!✅ Recruitment ProcessUnlike many Western markets, most companies here don’t use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems). Instead, recruiters manually review 8-10 resumes daily, meaning quality matters more than quantity.✅ Maximize Your Visibility •	Follow all major recruitment agencies and connect with recruiters in your field. •	Set up job alerts on their platforms. •	Email recruiters directly with a strong, well-crafted CV.Your job search isn’t just about applying—it’s about standing out!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#MiddleEastJobs hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SalaryNegotiation hashtag#RecruitmentTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#RiyadhJobs

In the bustling metropolis of Dubai, the real estate sector continues to soar to new heights, much like the iconic Burj Khalifa piercing the sky. Last week, the market recorded a staggering $4.1 billion in transactions, showcasing the city's resilience and allure as a global investment hub.Between March 10 and March 14, a total of 3,726 sales transactions were documented, with sales dominating the figures at $3.1 billion. This remarkable activity reflects not just numbers, but the vibrant pulse of a city that never sleeps, where dreams are built brick by brick. Among the standout transactions, an office in Enara by Omniyat in Business Bay fetched an impressive AED 87.6 million ($23.8 million), while an apartment in Luxury Family Residence III also in Business Bay sold for AED 60.23 million ($16.4 million). These figures are not just statistics; they represent the aspirations of individuals and families seeking a slice of Dubai's luxurious lifestyle.Additionally, the Land Department reported mortgage deals worth AED 3.15 billion ($858 million) and gift transactions valued at AED 350 million ($95.3 million). This diverse range of transactions illustrates the multifaceted nature of the market, where investment opportunities abound and the spirit of giving flourishes.As we look ahead, the Dubai real estate sector is not just a market; it’s a beacon of opportunity, drawing investors from around the globe. Una mano che ti stringe, e poi ti supporta, perché un integratore al tuo potenziale.Si sono aperte e si stanno aprendo nuove sfide, nuove opportunità di crescita e trasformazione. La vera sfida qua, è farci trovare pronti, con mente aperta, visione e determinazione, per trasformare ogni cambiamento in un trampolino verso il futuro. Ed anche se un giorno un robot dovesse portarci il caffè senza muovere un dito, saremo, e dovremo, essere sempre noi a deciderne gusto, intensità, e concezione.E tu in ciò, che sfida stai affrontando?hashtag#AI hashtag#UAE hashtag#Innovazione hashtag#Investimenti hashtag#Crescita

As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the “Establishment”) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the “Emirate”).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the “Department”) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.

🧡 Freelance Exchange taught me a lot. Here's the honest part.Over the last 10 years, I’ve worked as both a freelancer and someone hiring freelancers — especially from equity-deserving communities. And while I love freelancing (and freelancers), this dual perspective has shown me just how often our expectations miss each other.We built Freelance Exchange with Good Growth Hub to bridge this gap. 📎 You can read the full case study via Local Champions CIC (reshared below) — but today I want to be honest about the hard truths: the ones we often don’t say out loud — about working across power, pressure, and people’s real lives.My first freelance job was in 2014. Since then, I’ve built a six-figure consultancy career and run Local Champions CIC — a social enterprise and international consultancy working across the UK and Rwanda.I’ve also hired & managed over 30 freelancers in the last five years.Here’s the truth: it’s still one of the hardest things I do.Not because freelancers are difficult — but because the relationship between freelancers & employers, especially in small orgs like ours, is rarely discussed with the mutual understanding it deserves.What employers need to understand about freelancers:🫀 Life happens — family, mental health, burnout. I’ve missed deadlines too. What matters is honest communication. I’ve been lucky to work with partners like A New Direction who led with care, not punishment.⚖️ Many freelancers face systemic inequality. Equity is not charity. Building systems of access and support is justice.📚 Clear briefs unlock better work. Employers must scope well, pay on time, and model professionalism.💡 Invest early — and freelancers often over-deliver long-term.What freelancers need to understand about employers:💸 Budgeting for you matters — especially in small orgs. We hire instead of paying ourselves. If you want fair pay, remember: delivery and communication are part of that fairness.⏳ Missed deadlines cost more than time — they break trust. One late task can derail reports, delay programmes, or damage partnerships.📣 Communication isn’t optional — it’s part of the job. Up-managing is a superpower. The best freelancers check in, clarify, and flag risks early.🧠 Understanding how public/third sector employers work gives you an edge.📑 Deposits and contracts are valid — but so is delivery. You can’t expect full payment for half-complete work.The future of work needs both sides to do better.And we can — with honesty, shared values, and radical collaboration.🧡 Deep gratitude to every freelancer, partner, funder, and teammate who shaped this work. Let’s keep building better, together.✨ Freelancers deserve more than gigs. ✨ Employers deserve more than stress. 🧡 Together, we can build environments where both sides win.🔗 Case study @LocalChampionsCIC hashtag#FreelanceExchange hashtag#WeMakeChampions hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#Freelancers hashtag#InclusiveInnovation hashtag#SystemsChange hashtag#Entrepreneurship hashtag#LocalChampions

كنت في زيارة لدبي الأسبوع الماضي، مدينة حديثة ومتطورة وفيها كل شيء! بيئة مثالية للشركات، رواد الأعمال، وأكيد للشركات الناشئة اللي بتدور على فرص للنمو والتوسع. الأجواء هناك بتخليك تفكر جدياً إنك تكون موظف، صاحب عمل، أو حتى مستثمر… فعلاً دبي عالم آخر وشيء يفوق الخيال!اللي شد انتباهي كمان هو العدد الكبير من الأردنيين الموجودين هناك، سواء كموظفين أو أصحاب شركات، وهذا بصراحة شيء يرفع الراس! تشوف ناس من بلدك ناجحين ومؤثرين في سوق ضخم مثل دبي، هذا بحد ذاته دافع قوي إنه الواحد يطمح للأفضل.أما الصورة، فهي من Dubai Miracle Garden، واحد من أجمل وأشهر الأماكن في دبي! حديقة ساحرة بكل معنى الكلمة، أكبر حديقة زهور طبيعية في العالم، بتضم أكثر من ١٥٠ مليون زهرة بتصاميم إبداعية تخليك تحس وكأنك بعالم خيالي!لكن المفاجأة الأجمل كانت لما عرفت إن مصمم الحديقة هو رجل الأعمال الأردني عبد الناصر رحال! هو كمان وراء تصميم:1. حديقة الفراشات في دبي (Dubai Butterfly Garden)، أكبر حديقة مغطاة للفراشات في العالم.2. سنترال بارك في سيتي لاند مول (Central Park at Cityland Mall)، جزء من أول مركز تسوق مستوحى من الطبيعة في العالم.الخلاصة؟نجاحات الأردنيين ما إلها حدود، وكفاءاتنا دايماً بتوصل لأبعد الأماكن، مش بس محلياً بل على مستوى عالمي! هذا الشيء لازم يكون حافز لأي شخص عنده طموح أو فكرة إبداعية… الفرص موجودة، بس الأهم هو الإصرار، التخطيط الصح، وعدم الخوف من التحديات.180 Degrees for Empowering People Odai Baqaeen عدي بقاعين Bashar Khoury Mohamad Nsour محمد النسور Monya Haddad مُنيه حداد Zaid Billehhashtag#دبي hashtag#Dubai hashtag#الامارات hashtag#UAE hashtag#ريادة_الأعمال hashtag#الشركات_الناشئة hashtag#Startup hashtag#نجاح hashtag#إبداع hashtag#ابتكار hashtag#الأردن hashtag#Jordan hashtag#فخر_الأردن hashtag#DubaiMiracleGarden hashtag#حديقة_دبي_المعجزة hashtag#عبد_الناصر_رحال hashtag#DubaiButterflyGarden hashtag#CitylandMall hashtag#ريادة hashtag#فرص_النجاح hashtag#تحفيز hashtag#تطوير_الذات hashtag#بيئة_الأعمال hashtag#استثمار hashtag#ملهمون

𝗖𝗮𝗻 𝗗𝘂𝗯𝗮𝗶 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗹 𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗲, 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗱𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗹𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘀, 𝘁𝗼 𝗮𝗴𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀, 𝘁𝗼 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗧𝗲𝗰𝗵, 𝗽𝗹𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝗶𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗱 "𝗚𝗮𝗺𝗲𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗴𝗲𝗿"?Much like the previously overused term "𝗜𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗶𝗰," which was attached to virtually every project in the city, we are now witnessing the same trend with the word "𝗚𝗮𝗺𝗲𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗴𝗲𝗿."𝗧𝗵𝗲𝘀𝗲 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗱𝘀 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗯𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗲 𝗽𝗮𝗶𝗻𝗳𝘂𝗹𝗹𝘆 𝘄𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝗱𝗼𝘄𝗻, 𝗻𝗼𝘄 𝗺𝗲𝗮𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴𝗹𝗲𝘀𝘀, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗿𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗼 𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴𝘂𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝗼𝗿 𝗔𝗜-𝗴𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗯𝘂𝘇𝘇𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗱𝘀 𝗯𝗮𝘀𝗲𝗱 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗼𝗻 𝗵𝘆𝗽𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝗻 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗯𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲.With countless companies in our industry labeling everything as "game-changing," it's starting to feel less like a genuine shift and more like a broken record. If everything changes the game, are we even playing the same game anymore?Dubai real estate—developers, consultants, and PropTech—it's your move. 𝗘𝗶𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿 𝘀𝗵𝗼𝘄 𝘂𝘀 𝘀𝗼𝗺𝗲𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗿𝘂𝗹𝘆 𝗴𝗮𝗺𝗲-𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗼𝗿 𝗮𝗰𝗰𝗲𝗽𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝘄𝗲'𝗿𝗲 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗷𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘆𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮𝗹𝗼𝗻𝗴. A bit of advice: Let's simply call these developments what they really are—𝗶𝗻𝗻𝗼𝘃𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀, 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀, 𝗼𝗿 𝗻𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝘁𝗼𝘂𝗰𝗵𝗲𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗲𝗻𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆𝗱𝗮𝘆 𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗲. Don't just tell us; 𝘀𝗵𝗼𝘄 𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗴𝗶𝗯𝗹𝗲, 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗯𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗳𝗶𝘁𝘀.Look, I am guilty like everyone else of iconic, game-changing word faux pas - but I am trying my best to purge it from my lexicon. 𝗪𝗲 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗱𝗼 𝗯𝗲𝘁𝘁𝗲𝗿!What's the most amusingly exaggerated use of "Gamechanger" you've seen lately in Dubai's real estate scene? 🚀 Project Kick-Off Meeting: Setting the Tone for SuccessA well-structured kick-off meeting is more than just a formality—it's the foundation for project alignment, transparency, and momentum. In the UAE's fast-paced construction and development landscape, these meetings are critical to ensuring all parties start on the same page.Here’s what must be acknowledged and aligned during a successful kick-off:✅ Project Scope & Deliverables All stakeholders must acknowledge the full scope, key milestones, and final deliverables—ensuring clarity and avoiding scope creep.✅ Roles & Responsibilities Clear acknowledgment of each party’s responsibilities is essential—Client, Consultant, Contractor, and Subcontractors must know their deliverables and lines of communication.✅ Communication Protocols Agree on reporting structures, meeting frequencies, documentation standards, and escalation procedures.✅ Program & Milestones A preliminary project timeline should be presented, with agreement on the critical path, early deliverables, and long lead items.✅ Design & Engineering Submissions Clarification on submission timelines, review durations, and authority approval requirements (e.g., DM, DDA, Trakhees, etc.).✅ HSE & Quality Expectations Align on the project's health, safety, and quality standards from Day 1—including permits, inductions, and inspection/test procedures.✅ Risk & Opportunities Discuss known project risks and mitigation strategies early—openness now prevents surprises later.✅ Authority Regulations & NOC Dependencies All parties must acknowledge the local authority framework, timelines, and third-party dependencies critical to project success in the UAE.A successful kick-off is not just about starting—it's about setting a culture of accountability, collaboration, and shared goals.💬 Have you attended a project kick-off recently? Understanding ROI in Dubai's Real Estate MarketROI (Return on Investment) is a key metric in real estate that measures the profitability of a property. In Dubai, ROI is typically calculated as:📌 ROI (%) = (Annual Rental Income ÷ Property Purchase Price) × 100Dubai is known for its high rental yields, often ranging between 5% to 9%, depending on the location, property type, and market conditions. Factors influencing ROI include:✅ Location – Prime areas like Dubai Marina, Downtown, and Business Bay yield higher returns.✅ Property Type – Short-term rentals & furnished units often generate better returns.✅ Market Demand – High tourism & expat population drive rental demand.✅ Government Policies – Investor-friendly regulations & tax-free rental income boost profitability.Vipin Sharma Coldwell Banker UAE | Mega Homes Real Estate Brokers LLC Ilyas Elachari Laura Marcela Cantillo Meza Soumya Kalani Atul Mohan Tesfai A. The I’ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabi—ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, I’m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure you’re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:✅ Check Their License – Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.✅ Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder – Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agent’s profile and credentials before engaging.✅ Research Their Reputation – Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.✅ Work with Established Agencies – Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabi’s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.🚨 Red Flags to Avoid:❌ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisions❌ Deals that seem too good to be true❌ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contracts❌ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Client’s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isn’t just about choosing the right agent—it’s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlord’s office, thinking it will speed things up. But here’s the truth: a good agent can sense when they’re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do best—find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, you’ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

.أعلنت hashtag#هيئة_الطرق_و_المواصلات في دبي أن إجمالي عدد ركاب وسائل النقل الجماعي ومركبات الأجرة والتنقل المشترك خلال عطلة عيد الفطر المبارك 1446 هجرية 2025 ميلادية، (من 30 مارس وحتى 1 أبريل الجاري)، بلغ 6 ملايين و390 ألف راكب. وأوضحت الهيئة أن عدد ركاب المترو بخطيه الأحمر والأخضر، خلال العطلة، وصل إلى 2 مليون و427 ألف راكب، بينما بلغ عدد ركاب الترام 111,130 راكب، وعدد ركاب الحافلات العامة مليون و329 ألف راكب، ووصل عدد ركاب وسائل النقل البحري إلى 408 ألف راكب، ونقلت مركبات الأجرة (تاكسي دبي وشركات الامتياز) 1 مليون و686 ألف راكب، فيما سجلت أعداد ركاب التنقّل المشترك (والتي تشمل مركبات شركات التطبيقات الذكية ومركبات التأجير بالساعات والحافلات عند الطلب) 429,616 راكباً.لقراءة الخبر، تفضل بزيارة rta.aeDubai’s hashtag#RTA announced that the total number of passengers using public transport, taxis, and shared mobility services during the Eid Al-Fitr holiday 1446H / 2025 (from 30 March to 1 April) reached 6.390 million.The Dubai Metro, operating across both the Red and Green Lines, transported 2.428 million riders. Dubai Tram served 111,130 passengers, while public buses carried 1.330 million commuters.Marine transport services recorded 408,991 boardings, and taxis—including Dubai Taxi and franchise operators—served 1.687 million users. Shared mobility services—including e-hail vehicles, hourly car rentals, and on-demand buses—registered 429,616 riders across various platforms.To read the full news, please visit rta.ae

Job Market Insights from a Top Recruitment Agency in DubaiI recently had a discussion with a leading recruitment company hiring across the Middle East, and here are the key takeaways:✅ Salary ExpectationsFor Software Engineers with 5-6 years of experience (in strong tech stacks, the salary range provided to recruitment agencies is 20-30K SAR/month. However, your next salary increment will likely be based on your current pay. So, negotiate well—don’t settle for less!✅ Recruitment ProcessUnlike many Western markets, most companies here don’t use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems). Instead, recruiters manually review 8-10 resumes daily, meaning quality matters more than quantity.✅ Maximize Your Visibility •	Follow all major recruitment agencies and connect with recruiters in your field. •	Set up job alerts on their platforms. •	Email recruiters directly with a strong, well-crafted CV.Your job search isn’t just about applying—it’s about standing out!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#MiddleEastJobs hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SalaryNegotiation hashtag#RecruitmentTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#RiyadhJobs

In the bustling metropolis of Dubai, the real estate sector continues to soar to new heights, much like the iconic Burj Khalifa piercing the sky. Last week, the market recorded a staggering $4.1 billion in transactions, showcasing the city's resilience and allure as a global investment hub.Between March 10 and March 14, a total of 3,726 sales transactions were documented, with sales dominating the figures at $3.1 billion. This remarkable activity reflects not just numbers, but the vibrant pulse of a city that never sleeps, where dreams are built brick by brick. Among the standout transactions, an office in Enara by Omniyat in Business Bay fetched an impressive AED 87.6 million ($23.8 million), while an apartment in Luxury Family Residence III also in Business Bay sold for AED 60.23 million ($16.4 million). These figures are not just statistics; they represent the aspirations of individuals and families seeking a slice of Dubai's luxurious lifestyle.Additionally, the Land Department reported mortgage deals worth AED 3.15 billion ($858 million) and gift transactions valued at AED 350 million ($95.3 million). This diverse range of transactions illustrates the multifaceted nature of the market, where investment opportunities abound and the spirit of giving flourishes.As we look ahead, the Dubai real estate sector is not just a market; it’s a beacon of opportunity, drawing investors from around the globe. With its dynamic landscape and unwavering growth, Dubai continues to be a canvas where dreams are painted in vibrant colors, and the skyline is a testament to ambition and innovation.hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#InvestmentOpportunities hashtag#GlobalHub hashtag#RealEstateMarket hashtag#BusinessBay hashtag#LuxuryLiving hashtag#GrowthMindset hashtag#Innovation hashtag#EconomicResilience

Leggere di un investimento così imponente nell’AI, come questo negli UAE, un paese che per decenni ha dimostrato che vige concretezza nella loro visione, non è solo il forte segnale che il futuro è già qui, è l’invito a ripensare al nostro modo di lavorare e vivere in un mondo che cambia ad un ritmo che anni fa sembrava inimmaginabile.E quel “anni fa” sta sempre più diventando un “mesi fa”, perché i cambiamenti drastici stanno sempre più avvenendo nel giro di mesi, non anni. L’AI ci sta chiaramente guardando in viso, e porgendo una mano. Una mano che ti stringe, e poi ti saluta, perché può prendere il tuo posto. Una mano che ti stringe, e poi ti supporta, perché un integratore al tuo potenziale.Si sono aperte e si stanno aprendo nuove sfide, nuove opportunità di crescita e trasformazione. La vera sfida qua, è farci trovare pronti, con mente aperta, visione e determinazione, per trasformare ogni cambiamento in un trampolino verso il futuro. Ed anche se un giorno un robot dovesse portarci il caffè senza muovere un dito, saremo, e dovremo, essere sempre noi a deciderne gusto, intensità, e concezione.E tu in ciò, che sfida stai affrontando?hashtag#AI hashtag#UAE hashtag#Innovazione hashtag#Investimenti hashtag#Crescita

As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the “Establishment”) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the “Emirate”).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the “Department”) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.

🧡 Freelance Exchange taught me a lot. Here's the honest part.Over the last 10 years, I’ve worked as both a freelancer and someone hiring freelancers — especially from equity-deserving communities. And while I love freelancing (and freelancers), this dual perspective has shown me just how often our expectations miss each other.We built Freelance Exchange with Good Growth Hub to bridge this gap. 📎 You can read the full case study via Local Champions CIC (reshared below) — but today I want to be honest about the hard truths: the ones we often don’t say out loud — about working across power, pressure, and people’s real lives.My first freelance job was in 2014. Since then, I’ve built a six-figure consultancy career and run Local Champions CIC — a social enterprise and international consultancy working across the UK and Rwanda.I’ve also hired & managed over 30 freelancers in the last five years.Here’s the truth: it’s still one of the hardest things I do.Not because freelancers are difficult — but because the relationship between freelancers & employers, especially in small orgs like ours, is rarely discussed with the mutual understanding it deserves.What employers need to understand about freelancers:🫀 Life happens — family, mental health, burnout. I’ve missed deadlines too. What matters is honest communication. I’ve been lucky to work with partners like A New Direction who led with care, not punishment.⚖️ Many freelancers face systemic inequality. Equity is not charity. Building systems of access and support is justice.📚 Clear briefs unlock better work. Employers must scope well, pay on time, and model professionalism.💡 Invest early — and freelancers often over-deliver long-term.What freelancers need to understand about employers:💸 Budgeting for you matters — especially in small orgs. We hire instead of paying ourselves. If you want fair pay, remember: delivery and communication are part of that fairness.⏳ Missed deadlines cost more than time — they break trust. One late task can derail reports, delay programmes, or damage partnerships.📣 Communication isn’t optional — it’s part of the job. Up-managing is a superpower. The best freelancers check in, clarify, and flag risks early.🧠 Understanding how public/third sector employers work gives you an edge.📑 Deposits and contracts are valid — but so is delivery. You can’t expect full payment for half-complete work.The future of work needs both sides to do better.And we can — with honesty, shared values, and radical collaboration.🧡 Deep gratitude to every freelancer, partner, funder, and teammate who shaped this work. Let’s keep building better, together.✨ Freelancers deserve more than gigs. ✨ Employers deserve more than stress. 🧡 Together, we can build environments where both sides win.🔗 Case study @LocalChampionsCIC hashtag#FreelanceExchange hashtag#WeMakeChampions hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#Freelancers hashtag#InclusiveInnovation hashtag#SystemsChange hashtag#Entrepreneurship hashtag#LocalChampions

With its progressed Aquarius Sun conjunct North Node and Pluto - trined by natal Libra Pluto - the city's destiny is to balance power with fairness, innovation with social responsibility. This alignment calls for equitable wealth distribution, futuristic governance, and a shift from exclusivity to inclusivity. 🚀 Project Kick-Off Meeting: Setting the Tone for SuccessA well-structured kick-off meeting is more than just a formality—it's the foundation for project alignment, transparency, and momentum. In the UAE's fast-paced construction and development landscape, these meetings are critical to ensuring all parties start on the same page.Here’s what must be acknowledged and aligned during a successful kick-off:✅ Project Scope & Deliverables All stakeholders must acknowledge the full scope, key milestones, and final deliverables—ensuring clarity and avoiding scope creep.✅ Roles & Responsibilities Clear acknowledgment of each party’s responsibilities is essential—Client, Consultant, Contractor, and Subcontractors must know their deliverables and lines of communication.✅ Communication Protocols Agree on reporting structures, meeting frequencies, documentation standards, and escalation procedures.✅ Program & Milestones A preliminary project timeline should be presented, with agreement on the critical path, early deliverables, and long lead items.✅ Design & Engineering Submissions Clarification on submission timelines, review durations, and authority approval requirements (e.g., DM, DDA, Trakhees, etc.).✅ HSE & Quality Expectations Align on the project's health, safety, and quality standards from Day 1—including permits, inductions, and inspection/test procedures.✅ Risk & Opportunities Discuss known project risks and mitigation strategies early—openness now prevents surprises later.✅ Authority Regulations & NOC Dependencies All parties must acknowledge the local authority framework, timelines, and third-party dependencies critical to project success in the UAE.A successful kick-off is not just about starting—it's about setting a culture of accountability, collaboration, and shared goals.💬 Have you attended a project kick-off recently? What key points stood out to you?hashtag#ProjectManagement hashtag#ConstructionUAE hashtag#KickoffMeeting hashtag#Planning hashtag#SiteExecution hashtag#StakeholderAlignment hashtag#UAEProjects hashtag#ProjectControls hashtag#PMO hashtag#ConstructionLeadership hashtag#TeamAlignment hashtag#Dewan hashtag#ConsultantLife hashtag#GCCProjects

Understanding ROI in Dubai's Real Estate MarketROI (Return on Investment) is a key metric in real estate that measures the profitability of a property. In Dubai, ROI is typically calculated as:📌 ROI (%) = (Annual Rental Income ÷ Property Purchase Price) × 100Dubai is known for its high rental yields, often ranging between 5% to 9%, depending on the location, property type, and market conditions. Factors influencing ROI include:✅ Location – Prime areas like Dubai Marina, Downtown, and Business Bay yield higher returns.✅ Property Type – Short-term rentals & furnished units often generate better returns.✅ Market Demand – High tourism & expat population drive rental demand.✅ Government Policies – Investor-friendly regulations & tax-free rental income boost profitability.Vipin Sharma Coldwell Banker UAE | Mega Homes Real Estate Brokers LLC Ilyas Elachari Laura Marcela Cantillo Meza Soumya Kalani Atul Mohan Tesfai A. How often do we chase things in life—recognition, wealth, status, and material success—thinking they’ll bring us happiness? We set goals, climb ladders, and push forward, believing that once we reach there, we’ll finally be happy. But what if happiness isn’t at the finish line? What if it’s a conscious choice we make every day?Last evening, as I sat at Dubai Opera, watching Max Amini perform, I looked around and saw people from all walks of life—different cultures, backgrounds, and stories—coming together for one thing: laughter. No barriers, no labels, just pure joy. And in that moment, I realized once again that experiences like these, the ones we actively choose to immerse ourselves in, are what truly add meaning to life.That’s the beauty of Dubai—it’s not just a city of skyscrapers and luxury; it’s a place where people come to build their dreams and experience life. Finding that balance between ambition and joy, between success and moments that feed the soul, is what makes life truly fulfilling.Whether it’s investing in a home, a lifestyle, or experiences that bring you happiness, Dubai offers it all. And for me, moments like last night reaffirm that happiness isn’t something to wait for—it’s something to create.hashtag#LifeInDubai hashtag#HappinessIsAChoice hashtag#DubaiExperiences hashtag#DubaiOpera hashtag#MaxAmini hashtag#FindingBalance hashtag#Realtordubai

The I’ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabi—ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, I’m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure you’re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:✅ Check Their License – Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.✅ Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder – Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agent’s profile and credentials before engaging.✅ Research Their Reputation – Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.✅ Work with Established Agencies – Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabi’s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.🚨 Red Flags to Avoid:❌ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisions❌ Deals that seem too good to be true❌ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contracts❌ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Client’s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isn’t just about choosing the right agent—it’s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlord’s office, thinking it will speed things up. But here’s the truth: a good agent can sense when they’re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do best—find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, you’ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

.أعلنت hashtag#هيئة_الطرق_و_المواصلات في دبي أن إجمالي عدد ركاب وسائل النقل الجماعي ومركبات الأجرة والتنقل المشترك خلال عطلة عيد الفطر المبارك 1446 هجرية 2025 ميلادية، (من 30 مارس وحتى 1 أبريل الجاري)، بلغ 6 ملايين و390 ألف راكب. وأوضحت الهيئة أن عدد ركاب المترو بخطيه الأحمر والأخضر، خلال العطلة، وصل إلى 2 مليون و427 ألف راكب، بينما بلغ عدد ركاب الترام 111,130 راكب، وعدد ركاب الحافلات العامة مليون و329 ألف راكب، ووصل عدد ركاب وسائل النقل البحري إلى 408 ألف راكب، ونقلت مركبات الأجرة (تاكسي دبي وشركات الامتياز) 1 مليون و686 ألف راكب، فيما سجلت أعداد ركاب التنقّل المشترك (والتي تشمل مركبات شركات التطبيقات الذكية ومركبات التأجير بالساعات والحافلات عند الطلب) 429,616 راكباً.لقراءة الخبر، تفضل بزيارة rta.aeDubai’s hashtag#RTA announced that the total number of passengers using public transport, taxis, and shared mobility services during the Eid Al-Fitr holiday 1446H / 2025 (from 30 March to 1 April) reached 6.390 million.The Dubai Metro, operating across both the Red and Green Lines, transported 2.428 million riders. Dubai Tram served 111,130 passengers, while public buses carried 1.330 million commuters.Marine transport services recorded 408,991 boardings, and taxis—including Dubai Taxi and franchise operators—served 1.687 million users. Shared mobility services—including e-hail vehicles, hourly car rentals, and on-demand buses—registered 429,616 riders across various platforms.To read the full news, please visit rta.ae

Job Market Insights from a Top Recruitment Agency in DubaiI recently had a discussion with a leading recruitment company hiring across the Middle East, and here are the key takeaways:✅ Salary ExpectationsFor Software Engineers with 5-6 years of experience (in strong tech stacks, the salary range provided to recruitment agencies is 20-30K SAR/month. However, your next salary increment will likely be based on your current pay. So, negotiate well—don’t settle for less!✅ Recruitment ProcessUnlike many Western markets, most companies here don’t use ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems). Instead, recruiters manually review 8-10 resumes daily, meaning quality matters more than quantity.✅ Maximize Your Visibility •	Follow all major recruitment agencies and connect with recruiters in your field. •	Set up job alerts on their platforms. •	Email recruiters directly with a strong, well-crafted CV.Your job search isn’t just about applying—it’s about standing out!hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#MiddleEastJobs hashtag#DubaiJobs hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#SalaryNegotiation hashtag#RecruitmentTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#RiyadhJobs

As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the “Establishment”) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the “Emirate”).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the “Department”) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.

🧡 Freelance Exchange taught me a lot. Here's the honest part.Over the last 10 years, I’ve worked as both a freelancer and someone hiring freelancers — especially from equity-deserving communities. And while I love freelancing (and freelancers), this dual perspective has shown me just how often our expectations miss each other.We built Freelance Exchange with Good Growth Hub to bridge this gap. 📎 You can read the full case study via Local Champions CIC (reshared below) — but today I want to be honest about the hard truths: the ones we often don’t say out loud — about working across power, pressure, and people’s real lives.My first freelance job was in 2014. Since then, I’ve built a six-figure consultancy career and run Local Champions CIC — a social enterprise and international consultancy working across the UK and Rwanda.I’ve also hired & managed over 30 freelancers in the last five years.Here’s the truth: it’s still one of the hardest things I do.Not because freelancers are difficult — but because the relationship between freelancers & employers, especially in small orgs like ours, is rarely discussed with the mutual understanding it deserves.What employers need to understand about freelancers:🫀 Life happens — family, mental health, burnout. I’ve missed deadlines too. What matters is honest communication. I’ve been lucky to work with partners like A New Direction who led with care, not punishment.⚖️ Many freelancers face systemic inequality. Equity is not charity. Building systems of access and support is justice.📚 Clear briefs unlock better work. Employers must scope well, pay on time, and model professionalism.💡 Invest early — and freelancers often over-deliver long-term.What freelancers need to understand about employers:💸 Budgeting for you matters — especially in small orgs. We hire instead of paying ourselves. If you want fair pay, remember: delivery and communication are part of that fairness.⏳ Missed deadlines cost more than time — they break trust. One late task can derail reports, delay programmes, or damage partnerships.📣 Communication isn’t optional — it’s part of the job. Up-managing is a superpower. The best freelancers check in, clarify, and flag risks early.🧠 Understanding how public/third sector employers work gives you an edge.📑 Deposits and contracts are valid — but so is delivery. You can’t expect full payment for half-complete work.The future of work needs both sides to do better.And we can — with honesty, shared values, and radical collaboration.🧡 Deep gratitude to every freelancer, partner, funder, and teammate who shaped this work. Let’s keep building better, together.✨ Freelancers deserve more than gigs. ✨ Employers deserve more than stress. 🧡 Together, we can build environments where both sides win.🔗 Case study @LocalChampionsCIC hashtag#FreelanceExchange hashtag#WeMakeChampions hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#Freelancers hashtag#InclusiveInnovation hashtag#SystemsChange hashtag#Entrepreneurship hashtag#LocalChampions

كنت في زيارة لدبي الأسبوع الماضي، مدينة حديثة ومتطورة وفيها كل شيء! بيئة مثالية للشركات، رواد الأعمال، وأكيد للشركات الناشئة اللي بتدور على فرص للنمو والتوسع. الأجواء هناك بتخليك تفكر جدياً إنك تكون موظف، صاحب عمل، أو حتى مستثمر… فعلاً دبي عالم آخر وشيء يفوق الخيال!اللي شد انتباهي كمان هو العدد الكبير من الأردنيين الموجودين هناك، سواء كموظفين أو أصحاب شركات، وهذا بصراحة شيء يرفع الراس! تشوف ناس من بلدك ناجحين ومؤثرين في سوق ضخم مثل دبي، هذا بحد ذاته دافع قوي إنه الواحد يطمح للأفضل.أما الصورة، فهي من Dubai Miracle Garden، واحد من أجمل وأشهر الأماكن في دبي! حديقة ساحرة بكل معنى الكلمة، أكبر حديقة زهور طبيعية في العالم، بتضم أكثر من ١٥٠ مليون زهرة بتصاميم إبداعية تخليك تحس وكأنك بعالم خيالي!لكن المفاجأة الأجمل كانت لما عرفت إن مصمم الحديقة هو رجل الأعمال الأردني عبد الناصر رحال! هو كمان وراء تصميم:1. حديقة الفراشات في دبي (Dubai Butterfly Garden)، أكبر حديقة مغطاة للفراشات في العالم.2. سنترال بارك في سيتي لاند مول (Central Park at Cityland Mall)، جزء من أول مركز تسوق مستوحى من الطبيعة في العالم.الخلاصة؟نجاحات الأردنيين ما إلها حدود، وكفاءاتنا دايماً بتوصل لأبعد الأماكن، مش بس محلياً بل على مستوى عالمي! هذا الشيء لازم يكون حافز لأي شخص عنده طموح أو فكرة إبداعية… الفرص موجودة، بس الأهم هو الإصرار، التخطيط الصح، وعدم الخوف من التحديات.180 Degrees for Empowering People Odai Baqaeen عدي بقاعين Bashar Khoury Mohamad Nsour محمد النسور Monya Haddad مُنيه حداد Zaid Billehhashtag#دبي hashtag#Dubai hashtag#الامارات hashtag#UAE hashtag#ريادة_الأعمال hashtag#الشركات_الناشئة hashtag#Startup hashtag#نجاح hashtag#إبداع hashtag#ابتكار hashtag#الأردن hashtag#Jordan hashtag#فخر_الأردن hashtag#DubaiMiracleGarden hashtag#حديقة_دبي_المعجزة hashtag#عبد_الناصر_رحال hashtag#DubaiButterflyGarden hashtag#CitylandMall hashtag#ريادة hashtag#فرص_النجاح hashtag#تحفيز hashtag#تطوير_الذات hashtag#بيئة_الأعمال hashtag#استثمار hashtag#ملهمون

𝕋𝕠𝕠 𝕄𝕒𝕟𝕪 𝔹𝕚𝕘 𝔽𝕚𝕤𝕙 𝕀𝕟 𝔸 𝕊𝕞𝕒𝕝𝕝 ℙ𝕠𝕟𝕕? - hashtag#ENERGY analysis of SOME of Dubai's future prospects, from a critical thinking Energy GuideDisclaimer: My research is energy based and I explore many fascets, avenues to give a BALANCED viewpoint as a NEUTRAL observer. I wish to see EVERYONE WIN!2024 figures show 66.97m hashtag#UK residents - with ~4.55% of them millionaires. This figure is projected to decline to 3.62% by 2028. Factors contributing to this are changes in tax policies: abolition of the non-domiciled tax status, and a culture perceived as hostile to wealth creators - UK's transit chart is showing this clearly.Compare this to 3.82m hashtag#Dubai residents with ~72,5k millionaires, about 1.9%.​ The wealth of Dubai's royal family has an estimated net worth of $18bn. So we are talking big! A member on here wrote that one needs MINIMUM 10m nowadays to feel secure - but in Dubai? Even the underworld packs $1.5bn. So wealth is concentrated in the hands of the few - in a small pond.So I pulled up Dubai's chart. HE is MASCULINE 80% Yang, mutable 80% and fire dominant: basically a Sagittarius. Natally (1st pic) has Sagittarius Neptune, Sun, Jupiter, Mercury - in line with the welcoming, international melting pot of different cultures, stimulating environment, relaxed taxation image. Aries Neptune transit will further enhance this, but the Libra Pluto opposition (and other transits) will challenge it too. Sagittarius energy, while visionary, can also be dogmatic with rigid ideological structures that cover up deeper systemic issues. The “bigger is better” mindset can reveal cracks in the foundation of long-term stability. In progressed (2nd pic) the tension is between a strong T-sqare, and a fainter blue grand air trine - Aquarius Sun conjunct North Node (destiny) trine Libra Pluto Rx and Gemini Saturn Rx. Mars (action, drive) long progressed from spiritual warrior Pisces into hands-on, determined Aries warrior.I also see (3rd pic) a beautiful Pluto-Pluto trine on top of the Aquarius Sun, North Node combo: that is creating a national identity based on real Aquarian principles - coexisting in harmony and respecting differences. The road there will require a powerhouse of strategic intellect, sharp decision-making, and disruptive insight: the apex of the T-square is that Capricorn Mercury.For Dubai to achieve true Aquarian harmony, it must embrace radical transparency, decentralized power structures, and collective progress. With its progressed Aquarius Sun conjunct North Node and Pluto - trined by natal Libra Pluto - the city's destiny is to balance power with fairness, innovation with social responsibility. This alignment calls for equitable wealth distribution, futuristic governance, and a shift from exclusivity to inclusivity. By integrating cutting-edge technology with ethical reform, Dubai can emerge as a true beacon of progressive leadership in the new era.

🚀 Project Kick-Off Meeting: Setting the Tone for SuccessA well-structured kick-off meeting is more than just a formality—it's the foundation for project alignment, transparency, and momentum. In the UAE's fast-paced construction and development landscape, these meetings are critical to ensuring all parties start on the same page.Here’s what must be acknowledged and aligned during a successful kick-off:✅ Project Scope & Deliverables All stakeholders must acknowledge the full scope, key milestones, and final deliverables—ensuring clarity and avoiding scope creep.✅ Roles & Responsibilities Clear acknowledgment of each party’s responsibilities is essential—Client, Consultant, Contractor, and Subcontractors must know their deliverables and lines of communication.✅ Communication Protocols Agree on reporting structures, meeting frequencies, documentation standards, and escalation procedures.✅ Program & Milestones A preliminary project timeline should be presented, with agreement on the critical path, early deliverables, and long lead items.✅ Design & Engineering Submissions Clarification on submission timelines, review durations, and authority approval requirements (e.g., DM, DDA, Trakhees, etc.).✅ HSE & Quality Expectations Align on the project's health, safety, and quality standards from Day 1—including permits, inductions, and inspection/test procedures.✅ Risk & Opportunities Discuss known project risks and mitigation strategies early—openness now prevents surprises later.✅ Authority Regulations & NOC Dependencies All parties must acknowledge the local authority framework, timelines, and third-party dependencies critical to project success in the UAE.A successful kick-off is not just about starting—it's about setting a culture of accountability, collaboration, and shared goals.💬 Have you attended a project kick-off recently? What key points stood out to you?hashtag#ProjectManagement hashtag#ConstructionUAE hashtag#KickoffMeeting hashtag#Planning hashtag#SiteExecution hashtag#StakeholderAlignment hashtag#UAEProjects hashtag#ProjectControls hashtag#PMO hashtag#ConstructionLeadership hashtag#TeamAlignment hashtag#Dewan hashtag#ConsultantLife hashtag#GCCProjects

Understanding ROI in Dubai's Real Estate MarketROI (Return on Investment) is a key metric in real estate that measures the profitability of a property. In Dubai, ROI is typically calculated as:📌 ROI (%) = (Annual Rental Income ÷ Property Purchase Price) × 100Dubai is known for its high rental yields, often ranging between 5% to 9%, depending on the location, property type, and market conditions. Factors influencing ROI include:✅ Location – Prime areas like Dubai Marina, Downtown, and Business Bay yield higher returns.✅ Property Type – Short-term rentals & furnished units often generate better returns.✅ Market Demand – High tourism & expat population drive rental demand.✅ Government Policies – Investor-friendly regulations & tax-free rental income boost profitability.Vipin Sharma Coldwell Banker UAE | Mega Homes Real Estate Brokers LLC Ilyas Elachari Laura Marcela Cantillo Meza Soumya Kalani Atul Mohan Tesfai A. Tesfai Kartikeya Kasliwal Moitry Maiti

How often do we chase things in life—recognition, wealth, status, and material success—thinking they’ll bring us happiness? We set goals, climb ladders, and push forward, believing that once we reach there, we’ll finally be happy. But what if happiness isn’t at the finish line? What if it’s a conscious choice we make every day?Last evening, as I sat at Dubai Opera, watching Max Amini perform, I looked around and saw people from all walks of life—different cultures, backgrounds, and stories—coming together for one thing: laughter. No barriers, no labels, just pure joy. And in that moment, I realized once again that experiences like these, the ones we actively choose to immerse ourselves in, are what truly add meaning to life.That’s the beauty of Dubai—it’s not just a city of skyscrapers and luxury; it’s a place where people come to build their dreams and experience life. Finding that balance between ambition and joy, between success and moments that feed the soul, is what makes life truly fulfilling.Whether it’s investing in a home, a lifestyle, or experiences that bring you happiness, Dubai offers it all. And for me, moments like last night reaffirm that happiness isn’t something to wait for—it’s something to create.hashtag#LifeInDubai hashtag#HappinessIsAChoice hashtag#DubaiExperiences hashtag#DubaiOpera hashtag#MaxAmini hashtag#FindingBalance hashtag#Realtordubai
